Reviews.Title: “Very special weekend Away!”
Reviews.Author: littlelilies
Reviews.Content: My husband and i decided to get away for the weekend and we stayed here earlier this month, its not the first time we have stayed we choose to stay here for the spectacular views and comfy rooms. We booked a room overlooking opera house and harbour bridge. The hotel is close to everything and its just what we needed to unwind and relax. We dined out and we also ate in on our balcony overlooking the incredible views with some bubbly! Will be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home with magnificant view”
Reviews.Author: Dragonfamily
Reviews.Content: We have just had a two night stay in a 2 bedroom Harbour view suite and as described by other reviewers the view from the lounge/dining room of our apartment was absolutely breathtaking. As you walk in to your apartment and down the hallway everything else is lost in the fact that when you hit the lounge/dining room there before you is the amazing site of Sydney Harbour with both the Harbour Bridge and Opera House in perfect view. Pulling ourselves away from the view, the apartment was a great size with many great features. Two bedrooms, one with a king bed and ensuite(including a bath), the other bedroom with a queen size bed and another bathroom just outside. If needed both the beds can be split into two singles which is great when travelling with children. There was a fully equiped laundry(would be great for longer stays) and a kitchen complete with fridge, oven top, stove & microwave. The indoor pool was great and that also has magnificant views over Sydney Harbour. We only used the restaurant for breakfast but found the buffet breakfast had a wide variety. We found all the staff to be pleasant and helpful, from check-in to having room service dinner delivered(why eat out when you can order in and just sit back at 'your' dining table and soak in the view). On our second day my husband discovered that he had left his sunglasses in our car which had been valet parked. This was no trouble to the Concierge who in a matter of minutes had gone down to the car and retrieved them for him. The rate for Quay West Suites is comparable to other big city hotels, and even if it does cost a little bit extra it cannot be beaten for size, location and did I mention the view?

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Holiday”
Reviews.Author: keentraveller362
Reviews.Content: My sister, my daughter and I have just spent an amazing 10 days in a 2 bedroom suite with fantastic views of the harbour and opera house. The rooms were spotless and the staff were really friendly. The choice of breakfast was 1st class and we enjoyed every minute of our time here. The time went much too fast and we are now looking forward to coming back as soon as possible. It's just such a shame it takes 22 hours to get here from home!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty sheets bring a sleepingbag”
Reviews.Author: v c
Reviews.Content: Nice view. Dirty sheets, apon arrival I had to ask that our bed sheets be replaced as they were dirty. After having the sheets changed I checked the replacement sheets & they were also dirty containing hair, blood stains & a white candle like substance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: davidcalifornia
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 nights with my wife and we had a very positive experience. The staff was friendly and helpful and the location of the hotel was excellent. It was a 15 minute walk to the Opera House, which we went to twice. It is a closer walk to the ferry pier ( any visitors to Sydney should do themselves a favor and take a ferry trip to Manly, even if you don't get off the ferry, it is a great way to see the city)and a 10 minute walk to the botanical garden. Sydney is an expensive city and the fact that your hotel room has a kitchen is a real money saver. Ask at the desk for directions to Woolworths (the Australian Safeway) and you can buy food there. Eating out can really eat up your dollars, if you do it for every meal. I also liked that the room had a washer and dryer for your clothes. But the best part of this experience was the view from you room. We paid more for a room that had a harbor view, but it was worth it. You get a balcony and you can see a lot of Sydney harbor, including the Opera House and the ferry pier. It was constant action out of our window. The suite consisted of the bedroom and a large room that was a combination living room/kitchen, so you had much more space than your average hotel room. I would return to this hotel in a second, if I wasn't 11,000 kilometers away.

Reviews.Title: “Love the View”
Reviews.Author: John L
Reviews.Content: This place has a great view of Sydney Harbour , the bridge , circular Quay andthe opera house it roomy and very comfortable. The staff were extemely helpful & pleasant , on checkout I rang & asked if we could leave our car till 1pm that wasn't a problem and they even loaded our luggage (for 5 people) into the car for us. It was nice tto see the staff genuinely happy to help.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to stay again!!!”
Reviews.Author: BarbC835
Reviews.Content: Loved everything! Great central location to our chosen activities. The view from the 2 Bedroom Harbour View Apartment was breathtaking - didn't want to leave the apartment at all really. And the view from the pool and spa on the 23rd floor equally as good - didn't want to get out of the pool either. The apartment contained everything we required and then some. The staff were very friendly, polite and helpful. Definitely recommend a stay here - particularly in a harbour view room.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: WheelyGonzales
Reviews.Content: This was our 1st trip to Sydney & it was our honeymoon. Quay West Apartments is in a central location, 10 mins walk away from the Opera House. The staff made us feel extremely welcome (arrived after 10pm) & took our bags to our room. We had a city view but could still see the Harbour Bridge and surrounding waterways. The room itself was very clean, modern, spacious (as i am a active wheelchair user), with a bath and shower which had a removable shower seat. The maid service was very good with daily linen & towel changes as you would expect. The room service charges were comparable with local restaurants in the Rocks area. Matt, James & all the other staff/managers couldn't do enough for us and gave good recommendations for local restaurants & attractions. We checked out for a few days to visit The Great Barrier Reef - Quay West kindly allowed us to leave some of our bags free of charge in their luggage storage. All these little services made our honeymoon hassle free & enjoyable. There is also a free to use desktop PC in the lobby if you don't fancy paying for WiFi. Quay West is mostly geared to couples & business people, but we saw some families stay there too. In conclusion, I would recommend these apartments to anyone who wants high quality comfort but likes a few home amenities as well - we will defiantly come back & recommend to family/friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient”
Reviews.Author: joelenegoesonline
Reviews.Content: I travel to Sydney for work regularly. Quay West is fantastic as its a close walk to the business district, close to shopping and offers brilliant views towards the harbour. What I most appreciate though, is the sense of space. A fully equipped kitchen and laundry make this a really convenient place to stay. I like being able to cook healthy dinners and light breakfasts while I'm away. There's still the option of room service too. Not far from The Rocks and Circular Quay, there's a lot of options for social travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Amazing Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Gerry V
Reviews.Content: We could not fault our 3 night stay in the 2 Bedroom Harbour View Apartment, we arrived at the hotel at 9.30am, we thought we would drop our luggage and head out to explore, the friendly staff advised that our room should be ready by 2pm but they would see what they could do and would text me when it was ready, at 11.15am they sent a text to advise we could check in, what great service!,we found the room to be perfect with the most amazing views of the Bridge, Circular Quay and the Opera House.On the saturday night we wanted a cab to go to Darling Harbour for dinner, the concierge advised that because the trip was so short we would have trouble getting a cab to show up, he then proceded to run down the street to the intersection, hail a cab and sent it up to the entrance. I would highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Base for Exploring Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Generals1
Reviews.Content: We stayed six nights here. Wonderful two bedroom apartment with two baths, kitchenette, washer/dryer and amazing views over the Rocks to Harbor Bridge, Cruise Ship Terminal and Opera House. Apartment was spacious, clean and comfortable. Amenities are fine -- small indoor pool, serviceable workout room and nice sauna. Staff were very helpful. And the nightly rate was a bargain given going Sydney rates. Transportation hub at Circular Quay was a very quick 5 minute walk. Wonderful base to explore Sydney, beaches and beyond, including Blue Mountains. Definitely worth the extra price to get an apartment with a harbor view. Would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Two excellent stays”
Reviews.Author: Stragglers
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights before a cruise and two nights after the cruise. Arrived at 8.30am due to an early flight from the UK. Room wasn't available at this time but hotel texted us when it was ready at 12.30 and stored our luggage for us. We didn't go back until 2pm and they had already placed our luggage in the suite. Both apartments were excellent and roomy. We couldn't fault them. Small niggle was early checkout at 10am.Located near to Circular Quay and The Rocks areas. Well done to them.

Reviews.Title: “Great- better than a hotel”
Reviews.Author: FDSDarwin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights while in Sydney for a course. 1 bedroom Apartment was very spacious and of high quality; great if you're sick of poky hotels. Bonus was that it had room service. I wasn't expecting that in a serviced apartment: it was more like a hotel with more space. Front desk staff were great, and location was in the heart of circular quay. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great For Extended Stay, Worth the Price”
Reviews.Author: FlashDad
Reviews.Content: Note: As of 2012, Sydney is the 7th most expensive city in the world to visit. I have been visiting Sydney every few years since the early 90's, both for business and vacation. It has become so expensive, though, that this will probably be my last trip to a wonderful city. Having said that, I can really recommend the Quay West Suites. When planning for my 2012 visit, I decided to stay for two full weeks and wanted a hotel that could provide plenty of space for just relaxing between shows, dining out and special events. After researching a number of hotels in Sydney, I decided on Quay West Suites. The description of the accommodations sounded like what I wanted, and the location at The Rocks was important given the number of operas, symphonies and plays I planned to attend at the Sydney Opera House. Possibly because I had booked in for two weeks, I was upgraded to a larger suite upon my arrival...certainly a pleasant surprise! Aside from a spectacular view and the accommodations I was hoping for, there were several other features that made me really enjoy this hotel. The staff was extremely helpful, professional and friendly. There were a lot of little touches around the suite that I would expect in a top-ranked hotel, and others that were a nice surprise, such as the complimentary detergent provided for the washer/dryer, which allowed me to return home with a suitcase full of clean clothes! Another plus, which I didn't really notice until the very end of my stay was the "quiet." No sounds from adjoining suites or heavy footsteps tromping overhead...just an occasional ferry horn from the Harbor below, and on the last night of my stay, the sound of explosions coming from a spectacular fireworks display near the Opera House, which I enjoyed viewing from the dining table in my suite! Other than that it was one of the most relaxing hotels I've ever stayed in. I should note that this particular February-March (Summer in Australia) was one of the rainiest in Sydney's history, so it was especially nice to curl up with a book on the sofa in my full-size living room and whip up an occasional snack in my fully-equipped kitchen when I couldn't be out hiking about town or sightseeing. Considering Sydney has become such an extraordinarily expensive place to visit, if you've got the money, Quay West Suites is a good place to spend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: soljaz65
Reviews.Content: Spent five nights at this hotel in Sydney with my family. Location is fabulous; just a short walk to Circular Quay and the restaurants and pubs of the Rocks district. Chose a one bedroom suite with views overlooking the Harbour...waking up to 2 balconies overlooking Harbour Bridge and the Opera House was amazing. Even ordered room service on occasion and that too was fine. Staff are all helpful; kudos especially to Mark and Damien at the concierge desk. Bathroom large and modern, bed in master bedroom extremely comfortable. Simply a great spot.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: moxonssucks2
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with everything. Helpful staff. Great room and view. Very much enjoyed it's location and guests services. Be sure to take advantage of the pool and gym! Thanks for a great stay

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: BDB5000
Reviews.Content: I have just spent a perfect weekend at Quay West Sydney. Staff, fantastic, location - perfect, in room 1304 - View straight out over the harbour bridge and the opera house!!! Could not rate this any higher. If going to Sydney - STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money plus an upgrade!!”
Reviews.Author: HD123123
Reviews.Content: Thank you"QW TEAM in Sydney Rocks" - accepting luggage & car well in advance of check in time & prompt check out service at the crack of dawn - this enabled me to get back to The Southern Highlands in record time. Will be back soon!! Howard Davy

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views”
Reviews.Author: MikMate
Reviews.Content: My wife and i decided to stay in the city and splurge a little for the weekend. This hotel has amazing views and beautiful comfy rooms! We ate out so we didnt get to try the room service. We were so close to everything we wanted to do. We may need to splurge again very soon!

Reviews.Title: “quay west apartments in Sydney, australia”
Reviews.Author: timmm_11
Reviews.Content: myself and my two adult children traveled to Australia in October 2011 and after staying in Newcastle we decided to go down to Sydney for 2 days and one night. our friends that live in Oz had stayed their before and highly recommended it. How right they was. When we pulled up, there was someone there to park our car, we were asked if it was anyone's celebration so they could treat us to a bottle of champagne. Unfortunately i cannot remember the managers name but he was excellent with info in every-way, and nothing was too much trouble to make our stay a memorable one.as was the people on reception. we took a suite 5 floors from the top..... this is a must, as the whole of Sydney harbor is your view. although there are some terrific restaurants in Sydney, in the evening we had food delivered to our suite from one of the restaurants in the hotels information guide, And we just savoured the view as the sun went down. we had a two bedroom suite , the bedrooms were large, the kitchen was not over big but quite adequate for our needs... the towels were luxurious and the dressing gowns were also. there is an indoor swimming pool to use but note there are no lifeguards so probably not ideal for children to use on their own. but never the less, it was a decent size and we enjoyed using it. as parking in Sydney is quite expensive, this location is ideal as it is only about a 6 minutes walk to where everything happens in the harbour and is also close to the ferries. just note that if you have anyone with a wheelchair, there is one quite steep hill to get down and i think it may be a struggle to push someone back up the hill if the carer is elderly. ... a short taxi ride would obviously solve this problem.

Reviews.Title: “TnH”
Reviews.Author: Helen P
Reviews.Content: This was a first class apartment - the staff were really helpful. The only minor aggravation was that it was difficult to get a decaf coffee at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort in Circular Quay”
Reviews.Author: L B
Reviews.Content: We recently had a 5 night stay at this serviced apartment complex. The location was incredibly convenient - we walked to darling harbour, the rocks, the train and the ferry - and the accomodation was very comfortable. The staff - from concierge to housekeeping - were all very obliging. The block out blinds and curtains were very effective. The indoor pool - overlooking the harbour bride - was a total bonus for the kids

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located with wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Helen Z
Reviews.Content: The staff made a huge inpression on arrival and during our stay. A special mention to Matt, thanks for your help. We were pleasantly surprised with being given a penthouse suite for our stay and the views over the harbour were breathtaking. I would stay again in a heartbeat. Location is ideal for walking around the Opera House and Circular Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Suite - fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: roamingroto
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely 1 bed Exec Apartment with a city view rather than a view of the harbour, but we could also see up-river and towards Darling Harbour. The apartment was attractively furnished, very comfortable, with an extremely well fitted kitchen. Loved the fact that it was so central to The Rocks, Circular Quay and busy George Street. We used the cooking facilities to great advantage as after almost a month of eating in restaurants it made a pleasant change to eat simply in the apartment. Bed was comfortable, nice marble bathroom with bath and separate shower and there was even a separate laundry room - just great when you've been travelling for a while. The only negative thing was the operation of the in-room safe which was extremely temperamental and had to be opened/closed using a credit card rather than the room card. At times it could take about 20 swipes to open or close it and then at others it would open first time - maybe it was just that particular one? We really enjoyed our stay here and wouldn't hesitate to recommend these suites to anyone wanting quality space in the centre of Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “No better view”
Reviews.Author: J9Do
Reviews.Content: Stayed with 2 others for a brief break. The view over the Rocks historic area, the harbour view with bridge and opera house and ever busy ferries and cruise ships is as fascinating as looking at Hong Kong Harbour. Our 2 bedroom apartment was spacious and meant we could self cater with a grocery shop within 100m of the lower level access door. Alternatively we could eat out as suited us, with many restaurants and cafes close by. The patisserie in the Rocks makes wonderful delights. The access to trains was good and we walked to join the bridge climb - 10 minutes. There are a few steps in the area so those less mobile might not like that. The staff were very friendly and helpful and it took about 1/2 hour in the taxi to the airport at $48.00..

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Iaen
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect for those wanting a stay in the city, close to all city locations, yet quiet. My family of four stayed here for just one night, in a 2 bedroom apartment. The view is fantastic, all of the staff were professional and friendly, and the pool facility was great. All in all, great service delivered with a smile, and would happily recommend to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Special anniversary”
Reviews.Author: hopstepandjump
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked in for our 11th Wedding Anniversay a couple of days before Christmas and it was our first stay @ Quay west. We were greeted with enthusiasm and acknowledgment of our special occasion (even though we are in our 60's)! We were given our room..to find that it was set up by housekeeping for a family stay. We let the front desk know and to thank them very much as we were so grateful for the special fruit and bottle of Champagne. Within moments we were contacted by the evening Manager who immediately arranged for us to be transported to a higher level, upgraded suite without any hesitation, we were absolutely amazed..thank you so much for the most fantastic breakfast , room, view but especially SERVICE. We shall return and spread the word. Brilliant..and no fuss.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mollydog54
Reviews.Content: The Quay West Apartments were a great choice for a special trip to Sydney with my Cousin who was visiting from the UK.I have been to Sydney many times and stayed in a variety of places ,I chose Quay West for convenience and the views it offered, Quay West gave my cousin a fantastic feel of Sydney.We had a full Harbour view which overwhelmed them.We found the staff to be very helpful nothing was a problem for them.We enjoyed the buffet breakfast every morning,my cousin being Vegan the staff were so helpful to accomodate any request she made.Rooms were of a very good standard extremely clean and ammenities were very good.The only negative for the room was the air conditioning was a little noisy but not a problem.The Rocks is a great place to stay as everything is so accessable a little steep to walk back but Sydney is very steep at best.i would highly recomend Quay West and worth every $ spent.I will stay there again on my newxt visit to Sydney for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a family to stay”
Reviews.Author: Shropshirefamilyof5
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with 3 children, 14,12,12 in a two bedroom apartment. The situation in the Rocks is perfect, the view from our apartment out over the harbour was breathtaking. Sitting looking over the bridge and Opera House was amazing. The swimming pool on the top floor was also a treat, with large glass windows. Overall an excellent place for a family to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible views, fantasic pool, but a little rundown”
Reviews.Author: kfheller
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two bedroom apartment. You can't beat the view, it was incredible, overlooking the Harbour Bridge and Opera House. But the apartment itself was rundown, not what you would expect from a luxury facility. Everything just seemed a little bit dirty and in need of a good clean or remodel. The pool was fantasic, on one of the upper levels of the hotel indoors, overlooking the city. Breakfast was included in our price, and it was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: tanyiaw
Reviews.Content: I booked a 2 bedroom harbour view apartment after searching many hotels to stay at in Sydney, this hotel had really good reviews on this site. When we arrived we got the wow factor when stepping into the room, we were on the 9th floor and almost level with the harbour bridge the view was breathtaking. My friends and I could not stop gazing out the window at the view. We didn't have a balcony but this wasn't a bit drama as it was wet and windy anyway. The location is perfect close to everything. The satff are ven better. The concierges were great and very helpful and the restaurant staff and room service staff were fantastic, Querta (I don't think I have spelt this right) in the restaurant is fantastic I wish she was cloned and in every restaurant you go to lol. I would highly recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: nov973
Reviews.Content: Overall we loved the hotel......check-out seemed to go well although we couldn't get into our room when we first arrived at 8am. We expected this and were told we could leave our luggage and they would text us when the room was ready. Normal check-in is at 2pm and we were told that we wouldn't have to wait this long.....We received our text message advising the room was ready at 1.55pm.... One of the best features of the hotel is the location....Right in the middle of the rocks area with lovely shops and restaurants and cafes....only a 5 minute walk to circular quay....definitely the best location to explore Sydney from... The pool was amazing with fantastic views but don't expect a fantastic gym area....it's only a small room and is really hot before you even start your workout.... If walking back to the hotel from the circular quay area it's a bit of a steep hill climb to the front of the hotel. make sure you find the lift from the back of the building that goes straight to the lobby area located just inside the wilson car park. Ask the hotel for directions if you can't find. We wished we'd found it on the first day..... Overall a great hotel and I wouldn't hesitate to return to this hotel on my next Sydney visit....

Reviews.Title: “Iconic Sydney harbour view and great location”
Reviews.Author: Jasmond
Reviews.Content: Location is great -close to the Rocks, Sydney Opera House and within ten minutes walk to the heart of Sydney shopping district. We(4 adults) rented a two bedroom suite with harbour view and what a view from the 22nd floor!! I was slightly disappointed initially as I have expected more luxurious furnishings for the cost of Aussie $700.00 a day. However, as we got used to the apartment , we found the kitchen and the laundry room very well equipped , and the sitting room spacious with a spectacular view. We were lucky enough to see a firework display in front of the Sydney Opera House from our sitting room, courtesy of a cruise ship leaving port! . Only complaint is that the 2nd bedroom did not have enough storage space , eg. drawers and hanging rails and the single beds provided were very narrow. Not too comfortable for two adults staying for a week. The staff, both concierge and reception were very friendly and generally helpful. Room service was good value and efficient. Would stay here again for the view and convenience!

Reviews.Title: “What a View!!”
Reviews.Author: DannyBoyUK38
Reviews.Content: WOW!!! You will not be disappointed. Harbour view suit. What a location!. Excellent service from moment we got out of taxi, to room service where the girl who brought up the food and beer even offered to put the beer in the fridge. Hotel has undergone a recent re-decoration and has brought it bang up to date. No problems with anything. Will certainly recommend this a place to stay and will defiantly be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but.....”
Reviews.Author: SaffronRose
Reviews.Content: Quay west suits have a great location very close to the Rocks, Circular and the Opera House. We had a good rate for 1 bedroom apartment city view however when we actually saw the room it was very dark and miserable, pretty depressing after a long flight. The reception staff were very helpful and offered us an upgrade to a harbour view. If you stay here only book a harbour view otherwise don't bother. The second apartment was much lighter and comfortable. Be aware the apartments are really nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service to match the great location!”
Reviews.Author: Smallmoo
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at Quay West and we didn't know what to expect. We booked a 1 bedroom apartment and oar rival after a long drive we were offered a 2 bedroom for a very reasonable upgrade fee. The room was terrific. But what made this place was the service. The staff cared. They tried hard to please and were extremely welcoming and helpful. On checking out, they even loaded our luggage into our car which was a nice surprise. I also have to say that the website for reservations is really easy and well designed and allows you to tailor your stay requirements. Only downside was average breakfast, but the rest of the experience more than made up. Would definitely stay here again over better known 5 Star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: maryhillmagyar
Reviews.Content: On a hill, but there is an entrance at the rear, which you spot after checking in, but would have been better on arrival if you knew , with cases. 10 minute walk from the airport train. The rocks area with bars, shops, markets is 5 minutes away.Rooms are great and spacious. Staff helpful and rooms spotless. 10 minute walk to opera house, good 30 minute walk to darling harbour. Very central for shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Tony G
Reviews.Content: We were looking for somewhere close to the Rocks, Circular Quay and the city and we got it all and the voew of the Harbour Bridge, Opera House and harbour was amazing. The location to drive to was so easy. We came down from Newcastle and once over the bridge it took less than a minute and we were inside the hotel. The service by all the staff was fantastic the the two bedroom apartment was spacious and very comfortable. Cannot recommend highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views, spacious apartment. Very Happy.”
Reviews.Author: 2bundles
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend family trip. So handy to the ferry to the Zoo, the CBD etc. Parking was good and not too expensive. We used the family Zoo deal, and thought it was good value. Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best views in the world!”
Reviews.Author: Kelli S
Reviews.Content: The Quay West Suites were great. We had a really fantastic view of both the Sydney Opera house and bridge from our room. The room was fantastic - very clean. Room service was great and made the view even better - a great memory eating dinner watching the sun set over the harbour! Service was great and transfers were arranged easily. We had a great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend this Hotel to anyone!”
Reviews.Author: Guiliver
Reviews.Content: This was a very disappointing experience, apartments are very old and dusty, check in staff unhelpful, room service inedible, Internet and movie channels not working. View at night quite good but seen better. Would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location”
Reviews.Author: packedbags2010
Reviews.Content: Just tucked away from the city centre yet still very convenient and easy to get to. Hotel offers a fantastic view of Sydney Harbour Bridge which is delightful by night.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here for the best views of Sydney Harbour in luxury.”
Reviews.Author: DriverCheshire
Reviews.Content: We had booked at the sister hotel Quay Grand suites but due to a flood we were moved to this hotel, we were travelling with another couple and had booked 2 suites at the Quay Grand but were moved to a 2 bedroom penthouse suite. This was not a good option for 2 couples as the second bedroom is very small and has no views, whilst the master bedroom is to die for. If you want the best views of the Opera house and Harbour then look no further this is the place to book; interestingly the cost of the Penthouse was only slightly dearer than our previous booking and having stayed there it would be our first choice should we return.The management and staff were extremely helpful throughout our stay and nothing was too much trouble, specail thanks to Graham the duty manager and the Concierge who did their level best to help us to resolve our hotel transfer and the recovery of my wallet which had been left in the safe returning it to me at the airport by taxi prior to flying home. In essence if you are staying in Sydney and are looking for a top class hotel with excellent views you have just found it.

Reviews.Title: “Your window to Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Villgraine
Reviews.Content: I had a harbour view room which was wonderful. The room was much more than just a hotel room: cooking and laundry facilities, microwave, a true fridge etc. The hotel is situated in a nice area at the Rocks, and a walking distance to the city and the Bridge. The breakfast was very very good with excellent service. The biggest gripe is that the WiFi is not included in the room price, and internet prices are fairly high. In high-level hotels, WiFi should be included in the room price.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney Stopover”
Reviews.Author: Libster1953
Reviews.Content: My 21 year old daughter and I stayed here for a 3 night stopover on our way home to Hobart after a great holiday in Fiji and Samoa. We stayed in a one bedroom Harbour View suite on the 9th floor. My daughter had the pull out sofa in the separate living area. The views were spectacular.Including a great fireworks display at the Opera House for World Aids Day. Balconies from the living eoom and bedroom.Facilities and accommodation here are first class. We took advanrage of their buffet breakfast special. $19 each, normally $39. We had room service one evening because we were to tired to venture back out. The food and service was excellent. The hotels locarion is great. Close the The Rocks, Circular Quay and CBD. I would most definitely stay here again. Only one suggestion, perhaps a couple of small chairs on rhe balconies ro soak in those amazing views.

Reviews.Title: “Great, convenient place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Rybr
Reviews.Content: Outstanding place to stay. You can look around for other 'name-brand' places like 4 Sedona, shangri-la, but this place has it all and kitchen and in room laundry machine too! Entrance is not too fancy, but his place has all that you need and is a great location. Kudos to Ben (concierge) he will work hard to make sure you are taken care of. Do yourself a favor and book the harbor view room. You might otherwise be facing another building.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic View, Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Juno1988
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on Saturday the 19th Nov, I had a baclony Harbour view suite. The room was great, full kitchen and laundry seperate lounge room to the bedroom. We had a balcony that had an amazing view of the opera house and the harbour bridge. We were in walking disntance to man streets and were able to walk to our dinner reservation on Pitt St. Room was nice, modern decor. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: smr289
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and loved it. We had a city view room on the 21st floor and actually had views over Darling Harbour, the Harbour Bridge and the city which was wonderful. These rooms are fully self contained and fully serviced so much better than just a hotel room. The king sized bed was extremely comfortable. The apartments are situated in a wonderful area of the Rocks and you can walk to the city and the Bridge in a matter of moments. The breakfast was excellent with everything you could want. The gym and pool areas are terrific. Staff were all very friendly and eager to help with any queries. Only gripe was that we couldn't get a late check out. Loved this place though and wouldn't stay anywhere else in Sydney now.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, close to everything you need in town.”
Reviews.Author: SueP00
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during Novemer...great place for family accommodation in Sydney. Two teens make travel in city hotel rooms a headache; both are too big for rollaways, etc. Two hotel rooms likewise, works out an expensive option. We opted for a two bedroom suite with 2 bathrooms. The hotel is quiet, has a lovely lobby and in room dining available. It is within walking distance of the Rocks, Circular Quay, the Opera House, botanic gardens....all of Sydney's excellent attractions. The staff we encountered we're all lovely, and very helpful, the beds wonderfully comfortable. The air con system in room was a bit antiquated and a bit tricky to operate, the bathrooms were small but clean and functional. The concierge was fabulous. When checking out we left our luggage at reception with the request that we'd need a cab to the airport later....when we got back, luggage was loaded, cab was waiting...really efficient and impressive. will definitely be back to Quay West Sydney. Great solution for a family stay. If you can, go for the Harbour View rooms, and a high floor - its one of the reasons we love Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Magical views from Quay West Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Lesley W
Reviews.Content: I was recently lucky enough to spend three nights in a level 20 suite with an entrancing view of Sydney Harbour Bridge and Opera House - highly recommended to all interstate and international visitors. The suite was also superby comfortable and cozy, and the staff were unfailingly helpful and friendly. It's also near the Rocks, a great place to eat and explore, and walking distance to lots of shops. Do stay there if you get a chance!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: waltonwanderer
Reviews.Content: This was about the best hotel of our 8 weeks down under. For weary travellers it had all the space you need (we had a 2 bed), plus some great advantages like a washer and drier and a view to die for. I watched the dawn come up most days (jet lag!!) and the sun set every day and we hardly used the television as we had the most fantastic view of the harbour. Yes it's up a big hill (just figure out where the lift is and take a short cut using the escalator through the shopping centre and it's a breeze). We didn't take the breakfast option but bought a few basics and enjoyed breakfast watching the view for a much cheaper and more relaxing start to the day (with kids!) The location was great taking ten minutes to get to the harbour and the service was generally excellent (and we stayed on 3 different parts of the trip) so really tested them. They also let us store a case there for a week which was a real help when travelling through different climates. The rooftop swimming pool is small and not big enough for any laps but small children love it and the viewing window and it's amazing to swim so high up. I would return in a flash. The view from the window is my screen saver ....I don't think I've ever bettered it in any hotel.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Judith_S988
Reviews.Content: we were impressed with the proximity to everything and the cleanliness of the room. The food was good and the staff were very helpsul and approachable. we will definitley stay here again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Happy to return here again and again”
Reviews.Author: crisjoy
Reviews.Content: Staying in the city for son's wedding at Opera House so position was excellent - we could walk home. My parents stayed too , they are older and really enjoyed the views, watching the ferries and boats and people. We have stayed here a few times and feel this is the best place to stay in Sydney. Lovely apartments, very comfortable beds and good blackout curtains. We like to stay somewhere between floor 10 and 15 as we feel we can see more of what is going on in the Rocks, the Quay and the Harbour (too high and they look like ants) Staff very helpful and friendly always.

Reviews.Title: “What more could you want?”
Reviews.Author: Novajim2010
Reviews.Content: Great suite, great service and a great location. Centrally located in Sydney, close to the harbor and offering great views. Great for families and travelers looking for a something a notch above the norm.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing rooms, slightly lacking in atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: LeEcosseAgent
Reviews.Content: what you get from this hotel is loads of space, and in the case of the higher end rooms, lovely views of Sydney Harbour Bridge and Opera House. What it lacks is a bit of atmosphere, and although staff are generally friendly, they seem to be a bit understaffed, and not that clued uo on local knowledge in the few times I questioned the concierge. Great for familys who need a bit of space, kitchen etc, bit if you're looking for something a bit more buzzy or romantic, there are better options to be had. That said, there's no real complaints, to sum up, you're paying for the size of rooms and view rather than 5 star service.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST views in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: akrmelb
Reviews.Content: My husband and two preschool children stayed at Quay West for three nights in a 2 bed harbour view room. The view is literally amazing and captivated us and our children. We had a drink in the Shangri-La's bar 39 (famous for it's great views) and the views were not a patch on our bedroom. The room is clean and comfortable but definitely the wow factor is in the view not the apartment. The service is very friendly and helpful if not polished. And details like our room being serviced but full bins left overflowing don't really fit with the price tag. We have previously stayed at the Quay Grand and definitely found the apartment, service and ambience a great deal better. However this is a great place to stay with a family, the location close to Circular Quay and the rocks is great...and we made great use of the pool on the 23rd floor every afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “The wow factor”
Reviews.Author: Loulee
Reviews.Content: During the school holidays our family of four enjoyed a night in a two bedroom harbour view apartment at Quay West Suites. We were fairly confident as it is a Mirvac Hotels property and we have always had good experiences with their properties both here and in New Zealand. The Quay West did not disappoint. Plus it was incredibly family friendly. The kids were given a kids pack on arrival and they were catered for with kids menus and facilities. The view from our spacious apartment was stunning. We overlooked the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. Situated in a fantastic location, Quay West is only a few minutes walk from Circular Quay, the Rocks and George Street. With public transport in abundance once we had our car valet parked we didn't need again until departure. There are trains at nearby Circular Quay and Wynyard, buses along George Street and ferries from Circular Quay. The area has lots of dining options with many pubs, restaurants and cafes but we decided to enjoy in room dining as we couldn't take our eyes of the mesmerising harbour view. One highlight for the kids was the pool on level 23. The view from the recreation deck was even more spectacular with views all the way to North Head. I think I actually would rate the Quay West even higher than its sister property the amazing Quay Grand at Circular Quay. We cannot wait to return and would highly recommend the Quay West Suites to all visitors coming to Sydney looking for a spacious apartment in an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for families”
Reviews.Author: KevinATaylor
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Quay West Suites before joining a cruise around Australia. As others have noted the hotel has great Harbour views if you get the right room, and is conveniently located close to the Rocks. The suites (we had 2 bedrooms) were nicely finished if not enormous, and facilities very good. The staff are very friendly and made us feel at home from the moment we arrived. Breakfast buffet has a great choice and the pancake machine a big hit with the kids! We would definitely stay there again when visiting Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Prime location with outstanding views”
Reviews.Author: VATrav3l3r
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Quay West Suites twice in September 2011 for a total of seven nights - it was part-business and part-holiday travel. Overall we had an outstanding stay. Based on the recommendations of others we opted to spend a bit more for the harbor view 1-bdrm suite. It was absolutely worth it in my opinion. The view would "Wow!" us every time we walked into our suite! It felt like you could reach out and touch the Sydney Harbor Bridge. Our toddler thoroughly enjoyed watching the world, and the comings and goings of the harbor ferries, from our prime lookout. The room was a bit pricey, but for the amenities of a suite combined with the excellent location and amazing views, we felt if was worth it. Our 1-bdrm suite had all of the amenities we needed, and was ideal for traveling with a family, or an extended business stay. We ordered room service twice and were pleased both times. The staff provided outstanding service and always with a smile throughout both of our stays. The location of the hotel is perfect for exploring the sights of Sydney as you are a stone's throw from the Rocks and Sydney Harbor, and a short stroll away from Darling Harbour and the shops, restaurants, and sights of Sydney's CBD. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to friends and family traveling to Sydney. Its a well-appointed, well-managed hotel in an ideal location with amazing views of Sydney's prime attraction - the harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: artrartr
Reviews.Content: Great experience. Our family often stays here when we come to Sydney. Stayed in room 1206 with exceptional views of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House which is perfect for new years eve celebrations! Plenty of places to eat and drink, If you like beer make sure you check out the boutique beer bar across the road in Harts Pub, and also the Belgian Bier Cafe on Gloucester which has amazing mussel dishes. Only a short walk to Circular Quay and Wynyard Station so it was really easy to get to anywhere within Sydney including Taronga Zoo. If you're traveling in a group around the city you're better off getting a taxi or a bus. The free 555 city bus departs from George St. http://www.sydneybuses.info/free-shuttles/free-shuttle-information

Reviews.Title: “Great views, great staff, great stay”
Reviews.Author: Booshly
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Harbour view 2 bdrm suite (room 804) with 2 balconies. Graham (property manager or on duty manager?) made the trip special for my 2 daughters by learning their names before we arrived then greating them by name - they thought they were pretty special. Some little cup cakes and assorted slices with a card written out to my daughters was a nice touch (plus a bottle of bubbly for the parents...). Rooms were in good condition, views outstanding, the pool on level 23 & 24 has uninterrupted views of Harbour bridge and Opera House (see photos) and has a glass side wall. We had breakfast in their restuarant - good selection of hold, cold and pastries, etc.. and plenty to eat. Only minor blemish (and I mean minor) was that when having breakfast we had a pile of dirty plates that sat on our table for 10-15 minutes while the waiter & waitresses walked past a dozen times without removing them. I wouldn't stay at Darling Harbour again after being here - so much closer to the action and views to die for. Staff really made it worthwhile - very helpful and cheerful and bent over backwards to accomodate any requests we had and answered all our questions with a smile. Tip: if you don't like in room "spa/massage" treatment(ie. we have kids and not so relaxing), the Shangri La is right across the road and their Chi Spa is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect city location!”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Nads
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here numerous times. Sometimes with our kids in a 2 bedroom apartment & sometimes on business. Perfect location however it can be a bit noisy in the mornings with the ferries. If you're here on a tourist trip, stay here and use it as a starting point to explore the various destinations. Plenty of restaurants to choose from downstairs - however we liked walking along the harbour to 'The Rocks' district and grabbing a bite over there. Service is great and the people are always willing to help you in any way - that's a quality that's sadly lacking in many hotels in Australia. I wouldn't stay anywhere else if in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning views & excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Advsouth
Reviews.Content: A group of girls were celebrating a milestone birthday, so we chose a 2 bedroom suite on the 8th floor. Although not as high as some suites, we had to die for views of the Harbour bridge and Opera House. The suite was fully self contained and the furniture was comfortable. The only comment I had is that there was not enough comfortable seating for more than 2 people, there needed to be at least another lounge chair. Bathrooms were spacious, kitchen fully equipped and beds very comfortable. Concierge and front counter staff were exceptionally helpful, professional and easy to approach. The pool was beautiful although a little tyred looking. Fantastic breakfast with a wide range of choice, staff excellent. Would def stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Could not be faulted”
Reviews.Author: JetVortex
Reviews.Content: This was a weekend away organised for my wife and her friends. From the moment of arrival, nothing was an issue, the Concierge staff are amoung the best in Sydney, easy to talk to, took care of the car and the bags, again always with a smile. Reception was with a smile, upon arrival into the 2 bedroom harbour view suite, the view is enough to take your breath away. The room was a little short on pool towels, a quick call and we were meet on the recreation deck by a concierge ~ Mark with the towels. The breakfast area was a little small and we did have to wait around 15 mins for a table, the breakfast was what is expected of a 5 Star hotel, variety and quality. With the staff interaction we had, everyone is happy and smiling, there is no fakeness about the service offered.

Reviews.Title: “15 Months and counting”
Reviews.Author: Andlee100
Reviews.Content: Ive stayed here for 15 months after relocating for work. Great location in the CBD and good rooms, nice bedroom, lounge, kitchen and views. Better value than a hotel. Graham, Matt the Duty Management team a very helpful. Good choice for holiday and business.

Reviews.Title: “Great base to explore Sydney for family fun”
Reviews.Author: Monique B
Reviews.Content: We had our 2 1/2 year old son in tow for a short city break to see Taronga Zoo, the Aquarium and other parts of Sydney. This was an excellent base for our holiday and our son loved the apartments. The room was quiet, well appointed and very clean (the only place we have ever been where you can walk around barefoot and not have dirty feet)! The pool was lovely. We had a city view room but could see the Bridge and parts of the Harbour. The size of the one-bedroom apartment was just right. The in-room dining yummy and generous. The staff were exceptionally friendly and very child inclusive. The hotel is very well located at The Rocks - a short walk to Circular Quay for ferries/trains and buses, close to the city centre and Darling Harbour. Harts pub across the road is excellent (and handy) as well. Overall a great base and we would return without question if heading back to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Sensational Oasis for Business Travellers”
Reviews.Author: TrainerLady101
Reviews.Content: If you travel a lot for work you will no doubt understand that after a long day room service beckons...and the experience can leave you pining for home! Not at the Quay West Suites...I would happily eat from the room service menu night after night in this property. The room service menu rocks! Hot, generous and delicious, like a home cooked meal with the pizazz of being prepared by a chef. My one bedroom suite was immaculately clean, the bed snuggly comfortable, and the staff amazingly accommodating. Being located in the specatular Rocks district is a bonus, and it's in walking distance to the middle of the CBD too. It's great to stay in a property where the staff actually smile...all of them, all the time. Nice work Quay West, this property will be my Sydney base from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Kisha R
Reviews.Content: This place is beautiful and has great service and views of Sidney. Got the two bed room suite. Room 1006 has the best views. It is a 2 bedroom apartment. Worth every penny!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Harbour views to die for!!!”
Reviews.Author: SoozTazzie
Reviews.Content: Spectacular views of sydney harbour, the bridge and opera house greet you, as soon as you walk into your 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom apartment. Modern decor, spacious bedrooms and living area, fully equiped kitchen and laundry all added up to great convenience. If you dont want to cook, the room service menu is comprehensive and we found the food delicious. It was wonderful to pour a glass of red and watch the busy harbour turn on its light show at night. Met another couple who appreciated the pool and gym on site and its located a short walk to the Rocks, Circular Quay Ferries and George Street shopping. This is the 2nd time staying and will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “A hypnotic view in a great location”
Reviews.Author: cyantist
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed in a two bed 2 ba suite that was close to1200sf. Lots of space, washer, dryer, full kitchen. In the rocks section with a number of good restaurants nearby. Hotel has a small but well stocked bar and good restaurant. Breakfast was excellent but expensive (nominally $40 but $20 if purchased when you register). However the view of the harbor is so compelling you may not want to leave the room.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet City Suites”
Reviews.Author: HappiestTraveller
Reviews.Content: Quay West is well priced, comfortable, and the suites are well set up for those who wish to be self contained. About a 15 minute walk to the fabulous new Westfield shopping centre. Definitely make the effort to go the level 23 and have a look at the spectacular city views, with the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. Stunning!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous view, wonderful accommodations...but very pricey”
Reviews.Author: Notacamper99
Reviews.Content: So much to enjoy at the Quay West Suites! We stayed in a 2 bedroom Harbor View room on the 9th floor. We were told by the front desk that all Harbor View Suites have the same view. Pros: The view! Was wonderful to just look at the ferries coming and going in the harbor, with the bridge and opera house too, of course; the rooms were very spacious, clean, and very nicely furnished; beds had soft linens and were comfortable; master bath was spacious and the other bathroom was adequate; the location of the hotel was wonderful, very close to the Circular Quay and the Rocks and George St. shopping; friendly front desk staff; beautiful indoor pool and spa with gorgeous views as well; cleaning everyday and fresh plentiful towels; fully equipped kitchen so cooking meals is possible. Cons: Very expensive--you are definitely paying for the view and location; is located up a hill, so if carrying own luggage (not taking a cab) is quite a haul from the Circular Quay Station. Recommend using Wynyard if have suitcases. Concierges were *completely* useless--did not have information on ferry schedules and seemed entirely uninterested in doing basic searches (on computer sitting right on the desk in front of them!) for information on zoo opening times, restaurant options, etc. This attitude is unacceptable for a hotel of this caliber.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely superb”
Reviews.Author: Vishal M
Reviews.Content: Outstanding beautiful view one of the best hotels I have stayed at. Breakfast was fantastic but the thing that stood out the most was the Friendliness of the staff, they were absolutely superb. Hard to fault the facility, it would be nitpicking to do so. :) Well done. Look forward to my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we never had to leave!”
Reviews.Author: MichH76
Reviews.Content: Wonderful weekend away in Sydney, the staff from the moment we arrived to the moment we left felt like we had never really left home they were always friendly, upbeat and eager to assist! We booked a harbour view room and although slightly more expensive than the city view it was money well spent, plenty of room and the view is absolutely fantastic, unrestricted views of the bridge, opera house and Sydney's famous harbour! Breakfast in the restaurant was great, large variety, very friendly staff and kid friendly which can be hard to find in 5 star establishments these days! Very impressed and will most definately return!

Reviews.Title: “Delivered on every level”
Reviews.Author: Ali_S_247
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect solution when staying in Sydney for 6 nights. There were three of us travelling - myself, my husband and my father. We had a two bedroom apartment, with two bathrooms - we all had our own space, and a far better set up for us for this length of stay. The kitchen was useful to prepare breakfast on the days we needed to be out at the crack of dawn. Laundry facilities in the suite were a welcome convenience. Sydney was our first stop in Australia. After the flight from the UK we arrived around midnight, and had a warm and efficient check in. Our aim was to get to bed as soon as possible, to make the most of the next day. However, there was little to move us from the sitting room - the view of the opera house and harbour just transfixed us, as it did the same each and every day of our stay. I thought breakfast was a little pricey, but a good selection, so no major complaints. I wouldn't hesitate to return. Wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for families!”
Reviews.Author: Ingrid P
Reviews.Content: to everything with wonderful views of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House. The children loved the chalkboard in the restaurant which they got to use during breakfast and the indoor heated swimming pool which kept them entertained for hours! Would definitely recommend especially because of the size of the suites and the modern decor that is hard to find in many city hotels. The staff were always friendly and helpful, overall I was extremely pleased and will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Can't imagine a better place to stay in Sydney!”
Reviews.Author: daeusc
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay in Sydney for a family! Would stay again and recommend highly. Friendly and helpful staff and a very comfortable room with as good a view as you could have of the harbor - and wonderful to have a suite with kitchenette and washer dryer when traveling with children - a great value compared to comparable hotels which only offer a standard room - and room amenities were equal or better than any major US hotel chain. Location could not be beat and indoor pool was an added bonus also!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: mardrew
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights in July 2011. We had a 1 Bed City View Suite. As well as the city we could also see the harbour from our window (but not the Bridge or the Opera House). We decided to stay here because, apart from its good reviews on Tripadvisor, some friends had stayed here last August and were pleased with it and they had booked it because her sister and stayed there a couple of years previously. We were not disappointed. First and foremost, it is in an excellent location. It is just a few minutesâ€™ walk down to The Rocks area and also to Circular Quay where you can get either a ferry, train or a bus. You are also just a minute away from a busy street (George Street) of shops and restaurants. Sydney Opera House is no more than a 10 minute walk â€“ on past Circular Quay. The apartment is one that you could actually live in on a permanent basis as it has everything you need. As well as a fridge, cooker, toaster, kettle (plus the usual crockery) there was also a dishwasher. There was a separate small room housing a washing machine and tumble dryer. Our bathroom had a bath plus a separate shower cubicle. There was a TV in the bedroom. The lounge had a full-sized dining table and a large desk. Everything was of a very good quality. The suite was serviced daily. If we ever return to Sydney we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay with great views”
Reviews.Author: jennb75
Reviews.Content: When my family came down to Sydney to visit me, I decided it would be nice to stay within a hotel and selected Quay West due to its location and price. From the moment we arrived we were greeted with friendly smiles and warm greetings from all the staff. When we got up to the room we were amazed by the wonderful views of the bridge and harbour. The room was very spacious and the beds very comfortable. The location is so wonderful as we decided to head out for the afternoon down to the rocks markets and Opera house which are only a few minutes walk . My children absolutely loved the pool area and the roomy pool and the view from this level is exceptionall. The following morning after a great night sleep we went down to enjoy the breakfast which was lovely and had such a great selection outside of normal hotel breakfast food. Everything dfrom the moment qwe arrived to the moment we checked out was wonderful and I will defiently stay at this property again and reccommend for all of my friends to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with something for everyone”
Reviews.Author: MrsMcRich
Reviews.Content: I am a Sydney local but we decided to have a weekend in the city as a bit of a getaway. I didn't know much about the Quay West Suites but I am so happy we stayed there. They have fully equipped kitchens which makes it easy for budget conscious people to prepare meals in the rooms and save money BUT if you do decide to use room service - it is the best room service I have ever had. I am so used to feeling ripped off by room service which is usually really expensive, small servings and resembles microwave food. We ordered the wagu beef burger and the caesar salad and both were delicious. The room service was quick too. Every staff member was so friendly and accommodating. The location is really convenient and the view from the recreation area is unreal. I would highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a family wanting a stunning location”
Reviews.Author: stangoldengreek
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Quay West a few times and it just seems to get better and better. From the moment you check staff where extremely helpful. Room was ready kids roll way in the hall waiting to be placed in a our room. Porters had a luggage in a our room within 5 minutes of check in On checking out it was just as quick, car was at the lobby within minutes. Breakfast is awesome pre purchase breaki vouchers upon check in. Its fantastic value kids loved it Kids under 5 eat free staff are A 1 everything you can ask for papers, hot and cold breaki pancakes the works. O the room we stayed in was great 1 bed room with kitchen laundry dinning area and water view 03 type our favourite thank you to all the staff We re coming back ..And so close to Circular Quay, The Rocks and a wonderful pub 50 metres away A bonus !!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, location & views”
Reviews.Author: djblcalifornia
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom harbor view suite on the 21st floor. We looked out upon the Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Sydney Opera House and looked down upon the Rocks area. The furnishings were very nice and the staff was responsive and professional. The concierge even got us opera tickets with short notice. I'd happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic views....best in town”
Reviews.Author: Breidablik
Reviews.Content: We had asked for a good harbour view and indeed we gotit. We could see both the Sydney Opera House and te HArbour Bride from our 2 room suite,this is simply fantastic. The rooms are very nice and the amenities are just great. We stayed there for 4 nights and enjoyed every minute of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Amenities”
Reviews.Author: lautzpage
Reviews.Content: we were delighted with the checkin process, concierge service, and the suite we took. Great views of the city and harbor, close to restaurants and attractions, well equipped kitchen and washer/dryer was a bonus. Breakfast buffet was nice, but only with the half-price offer we took advantage of. normal buffet cost is about 40 AUD. For breakfast. we preferred the 'Brew' coffeshop down the street on Harrington. Not inexpensive, but food was first rate.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for families”
Reviews.Author: AbigailSB
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice with our toddler and really appreciate having the space and amenities of an apartment-style room combined with the services and facilities of a hotel. This time round we had a 2 bedroom suite which had huge windows looking out onto the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. If you're thinking of staying here, try to get parking included in the room price if possible - it can get a bit pricey during the week. Also, breakfast and room service are of a good quality but ridiculously overpriced ($78 for breakfast!), given the fact that the hotel sits in an area with numerous food outlets and convenience stores. It's also a shame that a 5-star hotel doesn't feel it can provide free wifi to its guests (we had to pay $29 per day). Overall though, this is a very good quality and convenient hotel and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Customer Service and Great Location what more can I say”
Reviews.Author: Savvytraveller14
Reviews.Content: The Rocks is a great area to stay in and explore no matter what time of year you will enjoy every minute!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome views of the harbour”
Reviews.Author: MPR1967
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights in a Penthouse facing the harbour. This was a free upgrade from the 2-bedroom suite-harbour view we had booked. Management was great and the suite luxurious and we much appreciated this upgrade. The one down side is that the hotel is not responsible for the state of the penthouses, which are privately owned. The one we had was very dated with ripped and filthy furniture. The overall cleanliness of the Penthouse was less than desirable too, which is looked after by the hotel staff. The hotel is an easy walking distance to the harbour, the commercial streets and to the botanical garden.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: GeraldClare
Reviews.Content: We walked into our 13th floor suite and were staggered by the view of the Harbor Bridge and the Sydney Opera House. The view was just grand, that's a fact, but the suite was absolutely first class. It had two bedrooms and a kitchenette. And when I say it had a great view I should also note that it was walking distance from the Opera House and this charming quaint part of town north on George Street with great restaurants and shops. The overpriced breakfast is not worth it - go down the street somewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great view of Harbour Bridge and Opera House”
Reviews.Author: Robyn2010
Reviews.Content: Fantastic 2 bedroom apartment with great views of the harbour especially the Harbour Bridge and Opera House. Great pool (with views) , spa and gym. My daughter loved the free Easter eggs on offer the 5 nights we were there. Fantastic location to Circular Quay for transport and The Rocks for the Sunday market and for the Bridge Climb. Would love to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous suite, immaculate, comfortable and what a view!!”
Reviews.Author: KEPACT
Reviews.Content: This was a quick trip for myself and my very young son. The suite was beautifully clean and comfortable and a great place to stay with children in tow. Excellent location and the views are great. Would definitely recommend the Quay West.

Reviews.Title: “What a view, cant beat Sydney Harbour..”
Reviews.Author: Suzie2747
Reviews.Content: With fantastic panoramic views of Sydney Harbour, with a bottle of champagne at your side there is no need to leave the room, perhaps only to dine in Harringtons restaurant located in house..... The accomodations were fantastic, very clean and comfy, well stocked and the staff were to say the least very helpful...nothing was a bother to them.... Our children especially loved the indoor heated pool and sitting watching the ever changing nite skyline, especially the light show on the Sydney Opera House...We celebrated a special occassion at Quay West Sydney and will definately be back again one day....

Reviews.Title: “We loved it.”
Reviews.Author: Grasshopper31
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Quay West Suites, Sydney while we had our Grandson with us. We booked in early in the day, approx12 noon, ordered beaut lite snack for lunch in the room, then went out to see Mary Poppins at the Capitol Theatre. Fabulous show. Returned later, had tea out and then came back for the evening. Breakfast next morning was fabulous with a great assortment of fresh foods and pancakes freshly made. Great checkout. All Good. Well worth it. GF.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: HSE
Reviews.Content: We had 4 nights in a one bed apartment and the word that left our mouths on opening the door was WOW! Honestly, this place is amazing, we had a view of the harbour bridge and the side of Darling Harbour and the furnishings and comfort was amazing. Through the reflection of the hotel next door (Shangri La) we could even see the Opera House. We would now hesitate to book a normal hotel room after being spoilt with a separate bedroom, kitchen, lounge/diner, washing machine!!!!!!!!!! The location was also fantastic just a few minutes walk to Circular Quay. We looked at many areas to stay in in Sydney and found this to be the best by far. We would highly recommend the Quay West to anyone looking for comfort and space rather than a hotel room. The leisure facilities were also outstanding with views to die for! We have been very spoilt here!!!! ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “Great apartments with a really stunning view”
Reviews.Author: bryan005
Reviews.Content: Great central location with all the benefits of a hotel and apartment, the apartment was a comfortable size and nicely presented with amazing views, we paid for a harbour view and it was certainly worth it. Although the staff were polite and the room was nice and spacious the overall service wasn't quite up to standard, concierge mixed up our bags on arrival and the room wasn't cleaned daily, these wern't big issues for me as i only stayed 3 nights but worth mentioning all the same.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In Sydney With Young Children”
Reviews.Author: The-Travel-Tot
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Quay West on 3 different occasions over the course of 3 weeks whirlwind trip to Australia. I absolutely obsessed over where to stay in Sydney with 2 kids and I am so glad that I chose this one. First of all it is not easy to find a hotel near the harbor that will accommodate a family of four (most only allow 3 people per room) but this hotel with their 1 bedroom suites plus sofa bed was perfect. Rooms are not super modern but are well appointed and very clean (with kitchen and laundry). The location and service are what make the place. From the time we checked in their service was commendable. It was 9am and our room wasn't ready so they gave us towels to take to the pool (which has a beautiful room of the harbor) and had us in our room by 11am. The hotel is in between the Shangri-la and the Four Seasons and is only a 5 minute walk from the harbor and a 15 minute walk to the Opera House. There is no better deal in the city for this hotel class than their "Kids Gone Wild" Package. For $349 (2 night minimum) it includes a 1 bedroom city view suite, buffet breakfast for 2 adult/2 kids (value $120 per day and it is a really nice buffet), family pass to the Taronga Zoo ($128) and valet parking. I checked out the Westin while we were in town which I previously had booked and canceled. It looked very nice but is much further away from the harbor. It is a little more expensive, and although their "heritage rooms" are very big, they still have 2 beds in the same room which isn't always easy with little ones. Stay here....it is great !

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Max357
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel as part of the Mirvac group of hotels. Was a nice hotel in a good spot with great views. Stayed here as we could not get into the Quay Grand. Would still choose the Quay Grand, however, this hotel still provided good value for money and was in a good location. Would not recommend to stay for elderly people as the walk can be a bit tough at times. But with that said, was a nice hotel with good services.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hirschs2
Reviews.Content: Location, staff, views of Sydney and hotel itself were all great. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great place with best of both worlds of hotel and apartment”
Reviews.Author: SianyT
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Quay West suites for two weeks, on a work trip to Sydney. The staff are lovely and very helpful, whatever time of day or night. The location is fantastic but be sure to ask for a harbour view room if you want one. Otherwise the view from the recreational deck floor is fab. The room facilities are brilliant and have everything you need whether you opt for room service and mini bar, or to cook a three course meal in the well appointed kitchen!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best....”
Reviews.Author: BusinessClass3
Reviews.Content: Had the pleasure of staying at the suites whilst in Sydney for business. This would have to be one of my Top 5 Best Hotels.....excellent location (The Rocks and it's history is fascinating), very comfortable lodgings, great breakfast and pleasant staff always. Stayed in a 1 bedroom suite which was really brilliant. In fact, i could easily live in this 1 bedder as it was large with excellent views and all modern cons. The bathroom was huge and the shower excellent. A dining area for a table with 6 chairs and a comfortable lounge. And we musn't forget the bedroom...a great size with a 2nd television and very comfortable bed. The location was also ideal for us as we had to use the Opera House for the duration of our stay. Circular Quay is a brilliant spot to sit and sip coffee across to the harbour bridge and city scapes. i would definately stay at the hotel again and would highly recommend it to anybody. Well Done Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: Chromeplated1
Reviews.Content: We stayed about a week at this hotel prior to a cruise of Australia and New Zealand. We found the location and hospitality perfectly fit our needs. The staff, in particular Graham Vogels, went out of their way to insure we were having a good time seeing and doing the things that most interested us in the area. Nothing seemed to be too much trouble for them, including Winny bringing her universal charger from home for our cell phone and camera! The hotel is great for a family. We enjoyed a spacious and beautifully furnished one-bedroom apartment, which included a kitchen, dining area, laundry room and a comfortable sofa-bed in the living room for our son. From what we could surmise, this hotel, although pricey, was a bargain compared to other hotels in the Rocks area. It's a good idea to get the delicious breakfast buffet option with the room, as it's well-priced as a package. Just make sure you children don't sleep through breakfast, as our son did! The hotel is located on a hill overlooking the Sydney Harbor and is within easy walking distance of lots great restaurants, shops and tourist activities, including the fantastic Opera House. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “So much more than just a hotel room.”
Reviews.Author: Girlea66
Reviews.Content: We last stayed at Quay West 8 years ago on our wedding weekend. Now we are back with our 5 year-old twins about to go to my brother's wedding in the city. It suits us perfectly. Many hotels don't cater for more than 3 in one room. Hete we have a separate master bedroom, laundry, bathroom and good-sized living area including sofabed which spells p-a-r-t-y to our kids. It's pouring rain but the view out the window is still great. And the price stands up well compared to other establishments. We are happy and our research has paid off.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but service is lacking”
Reviews.Author: PandaHouston
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a one bedroom at the Quay West Sydney for 3 weeks in January while on business. I was given a partial view of the Harbor Bridge which was a nice touch rather than a view of the city. Locationwise, it is very convenient. It is near the Circular Quay and in close proximity to the Rocks. The apartment itself is roomy and the advantages are there is a kitchen with a mini fridge, an eating area with a big dining table, a room with a washer dryer, a sitting area with a sofa and tv, a room bathroom with a separate tub and shower and a separate bedroom with a tv there as well. The room itself was clean and functional. As a long term stay hotel, it lacked a few things: Internet - it is not complimentary. I paid for access and even having to pay for this access, the hotel limits your bandwidth. When I spoke with the manager about this, I got a speech about how internet is expensive in Australia. TV Channels - there are only 10 channels on the television. Normally if I was here on vacation, it would not be a big deal but since this is more like a long term stay apartment, 10 tv channels just does not cut it. Service - the staff have a very lackadaisical attitude. They are never very friendly and I tried to have little interaction with them. If returning to Sydney, I probably would not choose this hotel for a stay.

Reviews.Title: “very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: jakelucy
Reviews.Content: stayed in 2 bedroom harbour view suite, from arrival everything went well, absolutely lovely room, very large rooms, view of rocks,sydney harbour,opera house,harbour bridge magnificent.. Easy walking distance to rocks,circular quay. swimming pool very nice but perhaps could have towels for guests instead of having to take from room. would thoroughly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “The prefect spot to relax in central Sydney”
Reviews.Author: AllisterF
Reviews.Content: We have stayed ay Quay West a couple of times previously and had very much enjoyed it. We stayed there for four night on this trip and it more than lived up to expectations. The suites are very large and very well equiped. It is a perfect base being just a few minutes walk from Circular Quay and a few steps from the Rocks. When we stay in the Quay Grand it is much like living in a modern apartment in the centre of Sydney. It has all the facilities that you would expect of a hotel although we prefer simply to use it as an apartment. The views are excellent -among the best in Sydney. The pool and fitness room are located on the 23rd floor and are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good central location, great views”
Reviews.Author: JenninMoscow
Reviews.Content: Good option for family, convenient location to all the downtown sights - Rocks, Harbour Quay, Opera, ferries to Zoo, Manly and other northern beaches. slightly longer but nice walk to Darling Harbor and botanical gardens. Suites are new, simply furnished "Ikea" stye, tasteful, comfortable and clean. Kitchen, and washer and dryer, free and convenient. Excellent breakfasts. Helpful staff. Our view over harbour was priceless.
