The only downside is walls were a bit thin and the energetic couple next door kept us up to the wee hours, but it was my mistake not to call the staff as they were mortified, apologetic, and say they are not embarrassed to ask guests to quiet down...

Reviews.Title: “Awesome views, great location...”
Reviews.Author: Peggy_Pegster
Reviews.Content: The hotel give you a choice of harbour view rooms and city view rooms. Personally, the harbour view rooms are the ones to go for if you want a room with fantastic view, with Sydney harbour and the Opera House as the backdrop - it has a truly impressive view. I am a little surprise the 5 star hotel does not come with bathroom slippers, but I guess it is designed more like a service apartment - henceforth, no bathroom slippers? It is a great place for more than a week-long stays for business leisure as it has a little area for cooking and laundry ( washing machine and dryer included). There is even a mircowave, a kettle, utensils in the kitchenette- it will be perfect for a family holiday with small children. Services are short of 5 stars however - it has problems with its airconditioning and heating. Although they were kind to offer a room change, it was made through a 7 am early morning phone call! To not miss out a new room offer ( they did not offer to keep the new room for at least a few more hours), there was a mad rush to get out of the room early in the morning, jet lagged, day 2 of the stay, minutes before a business meeting. Although a safe box is availble, it wasn't working...called reception 3 times on 3 different days and they offer to repair it each time, but nobody turned up....I was basically in the room for a week without a funcitoning security deposit box - on a lighter note....the place is so secure....maybe there is no need for one, especially I tend to travel cheap and light? :) I am however satisfied of the stay...I guess the location is really unbeatable...The Rocks is just down the road!! It really make the stay so pleasant!! Some hiccups in terms of services but....not something to stop me from returning I guess...especially if the price is right ! So will recommend if the price is right!

Reviews.Title: “Great views and restaurant but thats it!”
Reviews.Author: Ishkaa
Reviews.Content: We booked a one bed balcony and were given 2105. View was fabulous but noticed airconditioning not the best. We went out early next morning and came back to find it was obvious both fridges were faulty so when we went to reception we asked them to have the aiconditioning and fridges fixed. We were told they would get a serviceman to look at it the next day. When we arrived back late in the afternoon and enquired about the problems, we were told nothing had been done ( computer down and why know one used a phone blows me away) and they would look at it the next day. By this stage we had dripping water dripping from the ceiling. So when we went out the next morning and when we came back we were told all was fixed and new fridges installed. Instantly when we got to our room it was obvoius the airconditioning was NOT working. We phoned reception and they promised a serviceman would be sent up. After an hour of waiting my husband found they trip switch was off so he turned it on and the airconditioning came on. He immediately phoned reception to say what he had done and to cancel the service man. We got a call back to say he should not of done that as the unit had been siliconed and itwas to stay off for 24hrs. The hotel then decided we should move to another room. We were put in 1206 which was a 2 bedroom with an inferior view and seemed more cramped than a one bedroom! With no balcony either. The room was smelly and dirty. Newspapers we ordered arrived at the end of the trip after my husband lost his cool with a snooty concierge. Not exactly what would call a 5* hotel, it would be lucky to make 3.5 in our opinion. The only highlight was the excellent meal we recvd from Harringtons Restaurant and the equally excellent service from our Hostess Qeto.

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: Viagar
Reviews.Content: had a one bedroom apartment. the bed was very comfortable i thought and i liked the pillows. the paprtment had windows that opened- you dont always get that in the city, 2 tvs which was good. nice size dining table, pool was small, amazing view from the viewing deck . really god location. reasonable service but not outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great view, great location”
Reviews.Author: USPL
Reviews.Content: An overnight business trip for a convention and some meetings meant a CBD hotel. QANTAS had a special on this one for QFF and I grabbed it. Nice big suite with King bed, huge bathroom, full laundry & kitchen and a living area bigger than most CBD rooms in total. Harbour Bridge views out one window, city skyline the other.Two minutes walk to George Street and The Rocks for all the food and fun you could want, Belgian Beer Cafe for great food 100 yards south. If you are using the Airport train, get off at Circular Quay and walk five minutes west, take a shortcut through the Four Seasons lobby and save the climb up the hill. Also an easy walk from Wynyard. Didn't use the pool and recreation deck but went up for a look and it is certainly impressive. One minor quibble, climbing the steps to the main lobby entrance, THEN finding their was a lift to avoid that using the back entrance via Harrington Street could have been noted on the hotel web page, but as I say, only minor. On checkout I was able to use their cloakroom and save dragging bags to meetings, no problem and very polite, friendly and helpful staff throughout. Highly recommended and will stay again

Reviews.Title: “Almost fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Oshanda
Reviews.Content: In short - a great hotel in a fantastic location, but, with a sound problem. We stayed a night in a two bedroom apartment at the Quay West Suites. We were very impressed from the moment we walked into the reception. The place looked fantastic, staff were polite and helpful and the service was quick and efficient. We were even happier when we got to our apartment. It was modern, comfortable and had a great view to Sydney Harbour and the Opera House. Everything was "just so". The apartment had a small but fully equipped kitchen and a laundry. Pretty much everything we needed as a family on holiday. The location is fantastic. It is at just at the edge of the Rocks district in Sydney, so it was easy walking distance to the Rocks, Circular Quay, Opera house, train station and into the heart of the city. There are a great range of restaurants and pubs nearby. It was excellent. There was only one thing that stopped our stay from being perfect. At 6:30am on Sunday morning we were woken up by the noise of our neighbour taking a shower - I assume it was the noise of the hot water system. It ruined our plans for a long sleep in. As everything else about the apartment had been so perfect this imperfection really stood out. I found it hard to believe that an apartment of this quality had skimped on the sound insulation. After our stay Quay West Suites sent an e-mail survey about our stay. To their credit they sent me an apology when I complained about the noise. It was one major blip in an otherwise excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it used to be”
Reviews.Author: samuelynch
Reviews.Content: We stayed in two 1 bedroom suites. Check-in was fine but it went downhill from there. The unhelpful Front Desk couldn't even get a taxi to come to take us out for the night. The rooms were definately NOT Harbourview rooms as they were meant to be. The final insult from the very unfriendly staff was to be slugged $150 fee for 'carpet cleaning' but no one telling me at the time. It wasn't until I checked my credit card bill that I noticed the charge. I called them to enquire and they said they'd get back to me. A week later they still hadn't got back to me and now no-one can tell me much detail about what exactly needed cleaning. The service used to be great but it certainly isn't what it used to be - plenty of hotels left in Sydney that know how to treat their customers, so I'd give this one a miss.

Reviews.Title: “The most amazing view”
Reviews.Author: chab186220
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in 2007 for a couple of nights. On arrival our booking of a standard suite could not be found, but very swiftly they realised it was a mistake at their end and we were whisked to a 2 bedroom suite near the top and with a panoramic view of the bridge and Sydney opera house. In the evening we just turned off the lights and sat looking at the view, marvelling at what an amazing hotel it was. The pool was lovely and the hotel amazingly clean. Location was perfect. Highly recommmend.

Reviews.Title: “Gone down hill......”
Reviews.Author: uh2239
Reviews.Content: We have been regulars at this property over the past 5 years, in fact we had some 5 apartments booked here 2 years ago when we married in Sydney. Unfortunately the property has gone down hill since christmas 2009. The staff are very defensive about the slightest problem with the rooms. The lifts have always had a problem every time we have stayed(10 times!) in our experience there is almost always one lift in 3 not working and on top of that the lifts are dominated in the mornings by a miriad of housekeeping staff with large housekeeping trolleys, obviously there is no service lift!! The rates are supposedly guaranteed to be the best however we have found the rates to be very opportunistic with a clever pricing engine. For best deals talk to booking staff who will willingly help. Great location, reasonable furnishings but far from 4,5 star which are charged at times.

Reviews.Title: “superb”
Reviews.Author: carolineking2
Reviews.Content: By far the Best place I have ever stayed in Sydney.The view from our suite was fab both the bridge and the opera house in clear view. What really sets this establishment apart is the exceptionally helpful and friendly staff. The accomadation was very impressive clean comfortable and very stylish. The pool and gymn was an excellent bonus for the boys . Overall would recomend this place to anyone and a big thanks to Matthew on the front desk ,he was very helpful and pleasant.Well done management for employing tremendous staff

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic position and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Purdey
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent place, easy to walk to the Rocks area and Circular Wharf. Not bad for town either. We had bed and breakfast and ate out in the Rocks area in the evening. Very comfortable rooms. We had a two bedroomed suite overlooking the harbour bridge and opera house. Yes I suppose it is a bit of a splash out but well worth it - especially after flying for several hours. The suites are very good with a small kitchen, washing facilities and the fantastic view day or night. Breakfast is on the mezzanine level with plenty of choice. The pool in indoors up on the 20 somethingth floor. It is not huge but there is a seating area there if you want to read your book whilst the child is swimming. The views from up there are brilliant and you can go out on a balcony to get some photos. The concierge is very helpful and leaving bags or finding advice is not a problem. We have stayed here about 4 time over the years and find it a super place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortably Dull”
Reviews.Author: JamieMiller18
Reviews.Content: The hotel provides apartment styled rooms. Our party consisted of 3 boys ages 9-14 and 2 adults. The room had a master bedroom, a twin bedded room and a sofa bed. This comfortably accommodated us and provided adequate sleeping arrangements. A large open "living area" is nice and useful. There was a small kitchen section, a dining table, and some sofas. To add to this area there was a spectacular view of Sydney Harbor. One is able to sit and feel "on top of the world ". This view undoubtedly was the best feature of the room. You may question why my title is "Comfortably Dull" when the way I have described this room sounds adequate. The hotel lacks a factor which is what I always look for in hotels. An element of "Uniqueness". Everything is very standard. Although the room may be comfortably is far from unique with an element of character about it. The lobby is very plain and extremely boring. Apart from the view of Sydney Harbor you wouldn't be able to tell if you where you were. The service was adequate but far from excellent. There was no feeling of warmth and I didn't feel at all "special". There was a breakfast restaurant which we never used. In conclusion I felt the hotel was average and over rated. It didn't provide the most relaxed stay but did the job. Perhaps my disappointment is sparked due to the positive reviews I read before booking. If I returned to Sydney I would seek I hotel which conveys a feeling of uniqueness, is more boutique and provides a more relaxed stay.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Views from pool”
Reviews.Author: travelmystic
Reviews.Content: Our corner suite on a high floor had great views of the city and partial harbor views even though we did not pay for a harbor view. In fact the pool area had such fantastic views available to all guests it is not necessary to pay 3 times as much for the harbor view rooms. Every afternoon we went up to the pool to watch the sun set over the opera bldg. and watch the guests of the Four Seasons frolic in their pool below the freeway. The rooms our extremely nice with renovated kitchens and washers & dryers. The bedroom had a very comfortable bed and the sofabed in the living room was not bad even after 4 nights. The location is excellent and public transportation is 1 block away. A very good wine shop is also close and the grocery store is about 2.5 blocks. We also took a day trip to the Blue Mtns arranged by the concierge that was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the family and well priced.”
Reviews.Author: Bin5150
Reviews.Content: My wife, 8 year old son and I stayed for 3 nights to see the sights. We stayed in a one bedroom city facing suite in the 18h floor that was perfect for our needs. The rooms were all spacious and the queen bed and the sofa bed were very comfortable. We did not dine at the restaurant or order room service for our budget was small. We found the kitchen to provide all we needed. If you are looking to stock up on some grocery items there is a convenience store around the corner, but found that the Coles Express in the Wynyard Train Station (about 3 blockswalk) had a good range of all items we needed. We did dine out one evening and can recommend the Italian Restaurant across the corner for good quality and good sized meals (Giovanni's) We were very please over the whole experience of Quay West Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly Good”
Reviews.Author: KiwiMum14
Reviews.Content: I was travelling with four colleagues and expected to be staying at The Westin. A member of our group changed our booking and I found myself at Quay West Suites. My initial impression was low. It certainly isn't the lobby of The Westin. We arrived early and our rooms weren't ready yet. When we arrived back at the hotel a few hours later, room was ready and bags already in room. My first impression of the room was Wow. The room was big. When staying four nights I really appreciated the extra space a suite offers. I liked being able to walk out of the bedroom and have a lounge with a full dining table. The kitchen was great, as was the bathoom (good shower!). Having the luxury of a kitchen and dining table meant that rather than subject myself to the breakfast buffet, I was able to have toast and fruit in my room every morning. Overall I enjoyed my stay. Great location, good rooms, very friendly staff. I would recommend and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!! loved it!”
Reviews.Author: WendyNorthWest
Reviews.Content: Loads of space and well equipped, great location and fantastic breakfast included. Fabulous for a family. Gym could be better, but pool fab

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: wiltap
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel at the last minute, as we had checked into another accommodation in the area, and that turned out to be a disaster. We chose the Quay West Suites because we had stayed in the same hotel chain in Melbourne and quite liked them. The location of the hotel is perfect for Circular Quay and The Rocks. There is an abundance of dining options within walking distance, and a lot of shopping and things to do. The room was lovely, and well-furnished; we had a 23rd floor 1-bedroom suite. They changed the mattresses while we were there and gave us a down mattress topper. Very comfy. The view was great, Darling Harbor and the Bridge. From the recreation deck, right upstairs from us, we had a fantastic view of the Opera House, Circular Quay, the Rocks, etc. The service at the hotel is as you would expect of a property of this caliber. It's a great place to stay, don't hesitate to book it if it's in your price range. I would not hesitate to stay here again, or at any other Quay West property.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views!!!!”
Reviews.Author: soo_what
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Quay West for 3 nights in a 2 bedroom harbour view room, the view from the lounge room was amazing bedrooms view were kinda dull compared to lounge room. Easy walk when you don't have luggage back to circular quay, the rocks. Close to trains and ferries to other parts of sydney. Traffic sounds were loud at night. Watch your bill though was overcharged but was quickly worked out. Friendly staff, nice and roomy,

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view - lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: dexter1946
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the best location ever in Sydney with the most amazing views. The rooms are lovely, plenty of room. I highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “fantastic view and Excellent food”
Reviews.Author: Baku_20201
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in alot of hotels, but this experience had to be the best . The view was fantastic and too my surprise the food was phenominal. I have never had a better dinning experience t Quay West Sydney. The chef names is Dwight Peters and i would recommend that everyone eats there. A small restaurant hidden in the hotel. Fantastic fantastic

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay at a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: gypsy-curly
Reviews.Content: We stayed there during the Chinese New Year Parade. The suite we stayed has a very good view. It was very good to rest in a large and comfortable suite after spending a long day in Sydney. We had tea and coffee which are complimentary in the kitchenette. Only the pool and gym sections could be bigger and functional.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: Frequent travelers
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th stay in Sydney but we unexpectedly needed 3 nights accommodation during the Chinese New Year/Valentine's Day crush. Hadn't tried Quay West before although we have stayed in other view spots around the Rocks and the Quay. Gorgeous rooms and appointments! (these are suites with bedroom/living room/compact kitchen and dining area) Smallish terrace and we couldn't get a Quay-side view during this busy time so overlooked the Botanic Gardens (tranquil but not quite the same...). Only possible criticism is the $500 per night tab - I think the Harborside would have been worth it though. Recommend highly if you can get a better rate and the view!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome view, shame about the housekeeping.”
Reviews.Author: TravellingLady
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 adults and a baby stayed for 5 nights in a 2 bedroom suite. The panoramic view from the sitting room is truly awesome. There can't be a better view of the bridge and opera house anywhere in Sydney. The location was excellent, just a short walk to Circular Quay. The suite was well equipped with a full kitchen and washing and drying machine. On the downside, the decor was looking a bit tired and shabby and what really let it down was the housekeeping. Although the suite was clean on our arrival, the daily clean was poor and despite several phone calls our tea, coffee, bath gel etc were not replaced daily. The bath towels were old and thread bare - one even had a large hole. The staff seemed disinterested - several times during our stay we phoned the concierge and we were never successful in even getting a reply. Quaywest is large and impersonal. In my opinion the management need to make some investments and concentrate on staff training before it deserves to be called a 5 star establishment..

Reviews.Title: “Not International 5 Star â€“ Watch What You Pay.”
Reviews.Author: Rich5000
Reviews.Content: On this web site this hotel is rated as 5 star, if you have stayed in other 5 star hotels around the world, Europe, US, Thailand etc you will be disappointed. This is a problem we found generally whilst traveling through Australia. If you book the right room the views of Sydney harbor are unbeatable, the concierge in particular are extremely keen to please and canâ€™t be faulted but in essence the place is very tired, in desperate need of a refit and probably 3 or 4 star in quality by international standards. The furniture looks 10-20 years old and is worn and chipped; the carpets are stained, although the place is kept well cleaned. So it depends what youâ€™re expectations are, we initially booked our room at over $600 per night, at this rate it was poor value. By chance on the second day I noticed on the web site that the same rooms had been reduced to just over $300 per day. Under the cancellation policy I was ale to cancel and rebook at the lower rate, at this rate it was fair value, although we would have preferred to pay 5 star prices and receive a 5 star venue as originally anticipated.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Good Quality and great location”
Reviews.Author: BradandJanet
Reviews.Content: We regularly stay at Quay West. It is so handy to the Rocks area and Circular Quay for the ferries. As an apartment it is very modern and well appointed. Pay the extra money for a harbour view my teenagers still love watching the ferry lights at night! The pool is amazing and has the best view of the harbour bridge. Breakfast at the hotel is 'solid' and nothing special - I would recommend walking down to the rocks and enjoying breakfast at one of the nice cafes tucked off the main street.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for harbour views”
Reviews.Author: PatpetMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Myself, wife & 11 year old daughter recently stayed at the Quay West apartments for 7 nights. 4 nights in a 1 B/R city view apartment & 3 nights in a 1 BR harbour view apartment. We found all staff very helpful & friendly. The city view 1 BR apartment was adequate but a little cramped without a balcony. The harbour view apartment was excellent. It had 2 balconies & was more spacious. The views of tha harbour could not be surpassed. & the difference in the accommodation "feel" & experience was significant. We had originally booked a 2 B/R apartment for the final 3 days but as the 2 B/R rooms did not have a balcony we decided on the 1 BR harbour view apartment and that room met all our needs & had more than sufficient privacy for the adults. As has been mentioned in other reviews the beds in both rooms were too hard for our liking. The charges for Intenet & breakfast seemed steep & we did not avail of either for this reason. The location of the hotel is great & is within close vicinity of the Rocks & Circular Quay. We would definantely consider staying in the 1 BR harbour view room with balconies when we return to Sydney again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Sydney!!!”
Reviews.Author: luclen
Reviews.Content: We live in the country and travel regularly to Sydney for lesiure. We have stayed at numerous hotels and apartments and have finally settled on one we love - Quay West! The location is superb - right at Circular Quay. You can walk to numerous resturants, we take the kids for a run around Botanical Gardens, walk to Sydney Aquariam, Chinatown, close to all public transport. The room are great, we normally get a 1 or 2 bedroom harbour view apartment. Great size and lovely furnished and always so impeccably clean. Yes, it can be pricey, but you are paying for the location and service. Valey parking is fantastic, especially since we have young children. Breakfast is great, can get very busy but we are always early since the kids rise before the birds do!!! In summary, we are fussy guests who enjoy luxury surroundings and service and Quay West never disappoints!

Reviews.Title: “excellent, spacious accommodation in good location”
Reviews.Author: cowdalecottages
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Quay West Suites for 2 nights in December 2009.The staff when we checked in late at night were very friendly and helpful. The view from our 2 bedroomed suite was fabulous of the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House and the location meant it was easy to get down to the Rocks and Circular Quay. The suite was very well equipped and it was far nicer than staying in a cramped hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Locale and Rooms, Fair Service”
Reviews.Author: bayareadodgerfan
Reviews.Content: Overall we can recommend the Quay West for families traveling to Sydney. We were there with our 2 boys (13 and 10 years old) and we had a harbor view, 2-bdrm suite. The room was awesome! Really clean and spacious and of course, the view is great as other reviewers have stated. The room had a full kitchen, and washer-dryer (smallish by US standards). The only room issue was that we could never get the internet to work (and it is extremely expensive when it does). The hotel has a nice pool on the 24th floor with great view and a small gym. Our 2 gripes about the hotel would be that the food was only so-so -- a room service salad that was sandy/gritty and a breakfast buffet that was really mediocre -- and that the "service" was really basic. Front desk staff were friendly, but no one really went out of their way to be helpful or gracious and the "concierge" doubled as the bellhop (or is it the other way around?) The location was great, right near circular quay - sop easy access to sights and transport. So, all in all, we would stay again -- the rooms and the location is great, especially for families.

Reviews.Title: “great location and great views”
Reviews.Author: wheretonexxt
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel twice in the past year and obviously recommend it having gone back. The location in the Rocks is fab; just a few minutes walk to Circular Quay and the Opera House and within easy reach of shopping areas as well. Was deciding between this and some other hotels a bit further up George/Pitt Sts and went with Quay West because of the great views. Have stayed in both a 1 bed and 2 bed suite, and both are great with the extra added space and of the lounge/kitchen area. But, would highly recommend booking the Harbour View rooms; otherwise you might as well consider other CBD hotels. My only gripe w/this hotel would be with the service side of things; we requested items like extra towels which took over an hour to be delivered and it seemed like the front desk staff, both stays, were quite new and unsure of things. Expect a bit more given the price. Though, all in all, would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A "sweet" suite!”
Reviews.Author: gdaysydneysider
Reviews.Content: We got a really nice apartment suite in Key West Hotel facing the Sydney harbour bridge and Opera house. Not bad indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Great family-friendly option”
Reviews.Author: penalba
Reviews.Content: Quay West is a great classy hotel; it's in an ideal location, at least for a first-time visitor to Sydney and you get a full apartment instead of just a room. For a family with small kids, that's a big win -- when they go to sleep, you aren't confined to reading in the bathtub. The restaurant and room service are fine. The heated indoor pool on the top floor has to be seen to be believed; it has unbelievable views. I guess if you pay for the harbor views you get them from your room, too, but we had city views for a lot less money. It is seriously a five star hotel. Two important things: (1) There's a Coles grocery store underground at the Wynyard train/subway station, a few blocks away. It's a pretty full-on supermarket, not just a 7-11 convenience store. You're welcome. (2) The internet access at Quay West is disaster-grade bad. Don't even bother with it. It's stupidly expensive and doesn't work properly. Figure out some other way to get online. There; I just saved you eighty bucks!

Reviews.Title: “Great Harbour Views if you pay lots for it the worst managment”
Reviews.Author: uli1
Reviews.Content: Check in was slow and we had to wait forever for the room to be ready...Management thinks it's a great idea to put students as front desk counter staff of a 4 star Hotel...= very unprofessional . $40 for internet per day is the worst I have seen anywhere....and Mac Donald down the road has got it for free....I would not spent the money again

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience From Check-In -- Left Early -- Wouldn't Go Back”
Reviews.Author: Newburyport_MASheila
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Sydney by taxi from the train. Driver didn't know the hotel. Finally found it and no one greeted the cab The Concierge / bellman took our luggage and then we checked in with "Winny". Her immediate attitude was not one of accomodation. She told me we had a queen bed without a view. I explained that I was promised a king deluxe with darling harbor view. Then I proved it, she went on to say that it doesn't really have much of a view but they would see what they could do. They offered us two room which we checked out. The rooms are fine, antiseptic, could have been anywhere but nice anda good value for a major city. The view was okay but the Shangri-La Blocks most of it. We asked to see a Sydney Harbor view with Opera House and she let us but told us it would be $100 more per night. Then, when we came back down to tell her our choice, she said sorry -- Sydney Harbor view is $200 per night since they are busy. It was all terribly unfriendly and cold. We stayed one night and then checked out early and we very happy to leave. The restaurant is cold and sterile with tiny windows and again, no one greets you. The internet is $30 per day! They pool is very nice on the top floor but the whole place feels cold and unhappy. The breakfast was overpriced and underwhelming and "on special" for $19 per person. Would never recommend here unless you need lots of space for little money. No balconies or very, very tiny ones. Maybe good for a corporate stay. Seemed like a place to have an affair -- no one acknowledges you and everything felt cold and impersonal. We actually hated it. On the up side, we found the Sebel Manly Beach and couldn't have been happier. Even though it was a sister property, they helped us not at all when we decided to change our stay. Overall terrible service, yucky place. Clean, sufficient but not what I would call 5 star by ANY stretch of the imagination. Also, lousy, tiny fitness center and pool too small for laps.

Reviews.Title: “Very tired rooms. Fabulous views.”
Reviews.Author: tas3052
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in a harbour view two bedroom apartment on the 14th floor. Whilst the view was fantastic 180deg view of harbour bridge and opera house that was the only fantastic thing about the place. The room, reception and also the pool area is looking very old and tired and is in need of an update. The bathrooms in our apartment - particularly the shower recess was extremely dirty. Service is terrible. Our room was serviced but tea/coffe, milk, toiletries (shampoo etc) were not replaced. Towels are thin and hard and nothing like you would expect from a 5 star hotel. Reception staff are too busy surfing the internet to bother dealing with customers. Every request we had always seemed like too much trouble and was followed by a sigh. i would definatly not stay there again was extremely disappointed with our weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: jillch
Reviews.Content: Our family of three stayed here for a long weekend in a two bedroom apartment. As others have said before the apartment was well appointed, lovely and clean, with fabulous views. We booked for a good price through Wotif, and were a bit worried that we might end up with a second rate apartment in the complex, but not to worry it was great with plenty of space and nice furnishings, and the best view I've ever had. We also all thought the water pressure in the showers was stunning for a high rise! If I was being picky, I'd say the only thing missing was a tv in the second bedroom, but that wasn't a real problem. Location is great with an easy stroll to Circular Quay, to the Rocks or to the central city shopping. We didn't eat at the hotel itself so can't comment on the food other than to say the room service menu looked fine. Reception and the concierge were okay without being enthusiastic. Would happily stay again

Reviews.Title: “Superb Harbour View”
Reviews.Author: Rob1010
Reviews.Content: We prefer to stay in apartments rather than hotels when we travel, and Quay West is a good solution for travellers looking for an apartment with views of Sydney Harbour. You pay a bit extra, but it's worth it. The double view of the bridge and the Opera House awaits. The two bedroom flats in this complex are well appointed and have a small but pleasant and dining area, two good bedrooms also with harbour views and two bathrooms. Our only real criticism were the beds: the mattresses were just too hard for our liking. The management need to install pillow tops, which most hotel mattresses have these days. The apartments have breakfast available for $20 a head: nothing to write home about, but it does the job.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.....”
Reviews.Author: ZiggyNZ
Reviews.Content: Stayed at QW for 3 nights with a young toddler. 1 bedroom suite (deluxe) on the 20th floor gave great views out over the city with a peek of the harbour. Staff were very friendly, room was clean with good servicing daily. Suite was well equipped - 2 TVs, large lounge/dining and a good size bathroom with tub and shower. Only gripe was the outdated and awful MovieLink film system which should have died in the 80s. Location however was superb - both for The Rocks and for city shopping. Also by the discounted vouchers on your stay for breakfast - the buffet is certainly not A$35 worth of value.

Reviews.Title: “The Quay West Suites couldn't have been more perfect for the short stay we had in Sydney and the view breathtaking!”
Reviews.Author: BeenThereDonehat
Reviews.Content: We had travelled to Sydney from London and had only two nights in Sydney only. Saying that the Quay West Suites were brilliant is an understatement!. Our 2 bedroom apartment was fantastic! Fully equiped with washing machine/drier/fridge etc, there was so much room for myself, husband, Tom (11) and Sophie (8). It couldn't have been more perfect location for us. Everything was on our doorstep; the Harbour Bridge and Opera House we could see from our huge living room, and the added bonus of viewing a passenger liner parked on the door step too!. The area around is good for restaurants and shopping if you are a designer type however we didn't get much of that done. We had a trip on the ferry to Mosman and back which was great too. Well worth the money and would definitely recommend to EVERYONE. The Lewis Family - West Sussex, England

Reviews.Title: “Great amount of space for such a small price”
Reviews.Author: Orangebeat
Reviews.Content: I was really surprised but the size of my suite really got used to sleeping in a shoebox. You know roll out of the bed and straight into the bathroom, not with this hotel. I read that all the rooms are suites and have a full kitchen and laundry. Even though I was only in for one night, just having all that space and windows that open were such a GREAT BONUS! I stayed in what they call a deluxe city suite, but was able to take some great photos of the famous Sydney harbour from the pool area on the 24th floor. I will be looking into booking all my future stays with all the Quay West Suites throughout Australia & New Zealand

Reviews.Title: “...and a view money couldnt buy!”
Reviews.Author: SuitcasePacked86
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Quay West after our wedding and I wish we could have stayed forever. From the moment we arrived and the concierge took our bags I knew this was going to be a wonderful experience. The room was lovely and the view was SPECTACULAR! 180 degree view of the Harbour from the Sydney Harbour Bridge to the Sydney Opera House. The restaurant served some really lovely meals and the fantastic Concierge team were more than helpful in organising activities and tours for us. Overall a fantastic experience! I will be staying here again the the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Pam T
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Quay West Suites in the Rocks area of Sydney. Only a block from George Street if you want to catch a bus, including the free bus that goes around the CBD. Probably 3 blocks to the Circular Quay. Good view of the harbour from the living room. Also had a kitchen, bedroom and washer/dryer.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: rjg4321
Reviews.Content: Have just spent 10 nights in a 17th floor apartment with a superb view of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House. The large bedroom and en-suite bathroom were as good as provided by most highly rated hotels that we have used. In addition the large sitting room with dining table plus kitchenette and adjacent utility room with washing machine and dryer were a very valuable bonus. The aprrtment was very clean and modern and the very friendly and helpful housekeeping staff provided an excellent service. Because of the proximity to the ferries there is some noise as they signal their departure but we have found that wax ear plugs are a vital part of our travelling kit and necessary in almost all hotels anyway. The location of Quay West is perfect with very easy access to Circular Quay which is the hub of the Sydney transport system for both harbour ferries and the comprehensive bus system. A one week orange pass costs about AUS $45 which can be bought at the Ferry ticket office, covers both systems and can be used for virtually all the city destinations of interest to tourists. There is a short steep slope to get to the lower entrance to the hotel from George Street but we are both in our seventies and it would not put us off staying in Quay West again

Reviews.Title: “Dirty underwear and smelly cheese”
Reviews.Author: henri900
Reviews.Content: When first impressions are everything, then Quay West failed miserably. Checking in our two bedroom appartment and finding dirty underwear in the washing machine and an old piece of smelly cheese in the fridge, is not a great intro. Besides that the room smelled 'old' and 'dusty'. I don't understand they still use fixed carpets in hotel rooms. If you need a great view, book at Quay West. If you are looking for a new, fresh and modern room, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at Quay West!”
Reviews.Author: OzBuddha
Reviews.Content: After staying in Sydney for 3 weeks and experiencing 3 different hotels, we stayed for 5 nights during New Year's Eve. This was by far the best experience we had in Sydney (also stayed in Hilton and Radisson Plaza). There is no hotel at this price range (we paid A$227/nt) that combines space (we stayed in a 1 bedroom suite with king bed), location (in between Four Seasons and Shangri-La in the Rocks), and service (manager upgraded our room to have a bridge view; bellman courteously moved our luggage from one room to another with a constant smile). As always, we book everything on Wotif.com to get best prices. If you need another validation, the Australia cricket team during the Ashes tournament stayed in Quay West Suites (I'm sure they can stay anywhere).

Reviews.Title: “Booked 5 nights...left after the first one”
Reviews.Author: NuBrain
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for 5 nights after reading former tripadvisor reviews and left after the first one. It advertises as a 5 start property, which has nothing to do with reality. I still can't understand why people write good reviews about this property because my opinion is very different from theirs. It all started when I checked in... I ordered a taxi to pick me up in an hour's time, when I went to reception the whole lobby was empty, needless to say no taxi was waiting for me. The rooms are big but the ceilings are very low which makes you feel trapped. Windows don't have double glazing and the noise of the motorway kept me awake all night. Walls and ceilings seem to be made of paper, I could hear all the conversations of the rooms around, let alone their children crying at 5am. The gym is tiny and old and the pool was full of kids and dirty. The remaining of my stay in Sydney was at the Park Hyatt (see review there also), which really made a difference.

Reviews.Title: “No compassion or understanding for changes of booking dates”
Reviews.Author: keentravelerSydney
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed to hear this hotel is not very compassionate about guest who need to make changes to their booking due to extreme circumstances. Our situation has us caught up in the Bangkok protest meaning we are not able to get to the hotel as we originally thought. We attempt to call them up to 'change' our booking dates and not cancel it and advise them we are stuck with no other alternative. They were quick to shrug off our desperate request. We understand of their No Cancellation Policies and we accept this, but we are not trying to cancel, but merely just change our dates. At the rates charge per night, I think they could have been a little accomodating. So basically our hard earned money put towards this hotel has been forfeit due to the lack of understanding by this hotel. Again we stress, we did not want to cancel as we still wanted to stay at the hotel, only just change as we are currently still stuck in Bangkok till the airports are re open.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for extended stay with family”
Reviews.Author: johnathome
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Quay West in October for one week. Arrived via taxi and baggage was immediately taken and delivered to the room. Hotel was quiet and check-in was very quick. Our room, 1003 was a nicely sized one bedroom apartment. Room looked to be in good shape (little wear and tear). We had a partial view of the harbour, mostly of the city. There was a full kitchen. We cooked dinner a few nights. Although plenty of plates, glasses and utensils, there were a limited number of pots and pans. Technology wise, there were plasma tvs in both the living room and bedroom and broadband access (although quite expensive). Washer and dryer were in a separate room. The bathroom had separate shower and bath but some of the towel holders were coming off the wall. Electronic safe was particular as you needed to use a personal credit card to open and close the safe (versus a keypad). However, plenty of space to lounge out. One problem was the street noise. Surprisingly, the windows can be opened and the insulation was poor. We could hear the music coming from outside late into the evening on the weekend. Bed was ok, not the most comfortable bed that we slept in while in Australia. Hotel location is excellent. Walking distance to the Rocks and Circular Quay. In between the Shangri-La and the Four Seasons. Was a steep hike but there is an elevator that takes you up to the lobby from the street below. Breakfast was included in our rate and the buffet breakfast was good but not the largest number of choices. Swimming pool was on the roof. The pool was heated and had a wonderful view of the city of Sydney. Very popular with the kids including my son who wanted to swim every night after we got back. No problems with checkout. There was a 1% credit card charge as they had indicated when I booked the room. Had booked a taxi the night before and was there waiting for us. Overall, enjoyed our stay. The Quay West is a good choice for an extended stay especially with family.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service & location!”
Reviews.Author: plunk07
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in the beginning of September. We booked online at wotif.com and got a harbour view suite for $247 per night. Upon arrival we were greeted by Melanie who made us feel welcome straight away! She convinced us to purchase breakfast vouchers for $21.50 each, however i would definitely not recommend it! All of the food was cold by the time we had walked back to our table, and the restaurant felt a bit stuffy. I informed Raphael about the cold food situation, however she didn't appear to be bothered and made no attempt to rectify the situation. Upon check out I mentioned this issue to reception and was only charged for 1 breakfast for the inconvenience which was a great display of customer service. Our room was fantastic and the hotel had even organised a small gift for the celebration of our 5th wedding anniversary. The only issue we had with our suite was that the shower door didnt stay closed when showering so the floor got a bit wet, however by the time we had discovered this issue we didn't want to change suites so didn't bother informing reception until checkout. A highlight of the hotel is the heated indoor pool and spa located on the 23rd floor, as well as a sundeck. The pool looks out over the harbour and is fantastic! A great way to relax after exploring all day. The hotel's location is perfect, about 5mins walk from Circular Quay train. A little easier way to get to the hotel is to walk on to George St through the reception at the Four Seasons Hotel, take their lift up to level 2 and they have a back exit to Harrington St, cross the road to the Quay West car parking where there is a lift up to Gloucester Street. This cuts out most of the hills to the hotel and makes it easier with suitcases! But i wouldn't advise getting caught by the staff of the 4 Seasons!! Ensure to check out the French Patissarie hidden within the 'Nurses Walk' off George St...absolute heaven! Overall a fantastic stay and Melanie at reception is a tresure...nothing was too much trouble!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Choice in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Flunie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and two teenagers recently stayed at this suite hotel for a total of 7 nights. We stayed here for 3 nights and then left to tour other parts of Australia (conveniently leaving several pieces of luggage in storage at Quay West) returning for 4 nights. We were very pleased with our choice. First off, the location is excellent. Very well situated with walking distance to Circular Quay and the main shopping district. Secondly, it was a very convenient choice for a family such as ours. we had a two bed, two bath suite so we avoided having to get two separate rooms. It had a full kitchen, living room and laundry facilities which is great for extended stays and to prepare a simple breakfast. The buffet at the hotel is very nice, but expensive. If you prefer that, at least ask the front desk for "vouchers", which reduce the cost from AUD 30 pp to about AUD 21 pp. The very best feature of the suite was our stunning view of the Opera House and Harbour. This alone was worth the price of admission. On the other hand, I'm not sure this is a great choice for a business person trip. Taxis aren't easy to come by, the internet service was down and even when working, not handy, etc. The service was friendly and good, but I would classify this property as a 4 star, not a 5 star. Still, for a family, this is a wonderful choice.

Reviews.Title: “Not just a hotel.. more like an apartment with privacy and quiet”
Reviews.Author: blah114
Reviews.Content: I checked out of Shangri La to stay at this place, and really wished I had stayed here the entire 30+night stay in Sydney. The hotel is in the Rocks area, sandwiched between two streets, which makes it SUPER QUIET. It is hard to find, as the back entrance is off Harrington street. Full laundry, dishwasher, oven, microwave, fridge, yet maid service, mini bar, etc. Everything anyone needs is at this hotel, including room service. Why eat in the room, though? We brought water, soda, Arnott's cookies , etc to the room and really had peace and quiet. The views were amazing as well. Not once did we hear other people. There are very few rooms on the floors. The residents live in the high floors. We loved this place. My biggest complaint, however, is they changed the rates on us after we booked the place. I really had to argue with them about this. I suggest getting your rates PER NIGHT in writing 100%. They upped our rates on various nights by $69 AUD. I had to speak to the manager, as I felt scammed. They ended up finally just increasing it by $19 on various nights. How can a place get away with this? We were told our rate was $159 per night for 7 nights. When we checked out, some of the nights were $180, $205, $169.. very strange--WHAT A SCAM, and WHAT UTTER BS. Other than this, we loved the staff, the hotel, the convenience of being so close to everything, yet blocks away from the noise. We would return here, but would simply request the nightly rate--BY DATE-- in writing. The hotel does not have the service of Shangri La, but feels more like "home" to people. LCD TVs in the living room, bedroom also, nice bathroom, Bliss shower products, dish soap, laundry soap. Doing laundry while traveling is a nice convenience and this alone makes this place worth staying. Even if there is noise, which we did not hear, you can turn up the air such that it is loud. DSL, etc for a price, pay per view, etc. Staff was really nice here also. Did not care for the changing rates.. I am really not sure how the hotel can get away with this when they do not appear to disclose this with guests--they maybe forgot to do this with just us? Doubtful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view, shame about the hotel”
Reviews.Author: MJW2London
Reviews.Content: The Quay West Suites facing the harbour boasts spectacular views of the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. Unfortunately, the 5-star rating of this hotel ends there. Service at this hotel was poor, and certainly not up the the standard of a luxury hotel. The in-house restaurant is only open on Fridays...any meals taken at other times are solely via room service, which also happens to incur a $5 service charge. When orders come, they arrive with mistakes, and the standard of the cuisine is mediocre (though why you would want to eat in-doors being so central is another matter). Serious room faults were repeatedly reported, but never acted upon by front desk staff; the severity of the problem was only acknowledged when we were checked out by a more senior member of staff. The promise of a suite upgrade on a future visit however, is somewhat wanting. During our stay, the swimming pool, spa and gym facilities were being upgraded, though check-in staff neglected to in form us of this...would anyone have checked into a 5 star hotel knowing this? The hotel is well located in the Harbour area, though the standard of the hotel itself was inadequate, as were the facilities and usefulness of the staff. Book a suite if you want a room with a view; go elsewhere if you want the 5-star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Anthony13
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, Superb views Very clean and comfortable suite Shops very local Would highly recommend staying Facilities great

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrentfordSaint
Reviews.Content: Had a five night stay at this hotel - and it was exactly what you need for a business stay. The staff were superb, especially the Mel and Mel show at reception. Nothing was too much bother and they were all keen to offer their personal opinion on where to go and what to do. The rooms were large, very functional, had superb views and all the additional extras that you'd look for in an extended stay (love that they had individual laundry machines and dryers). Location could not be better, only five minutes to The Rocks and even closer to Circular Quay. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow...what a view !!!”
Reviews.Author: Hawaii50
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at Quay West Suites. My 3 sisters & I took Mum to Sydney for her 70th birthday. It was also the year of her 50th wedding anniversary and Sydney was where my parents honeymooned, so she had not been back for that long !!! We had a fantastic 2 bdrm Harbour View suite on 17th floor. The view was breathtaking overlooking Harbour Bridge & Opera House. At night we left the blinds open to watch the lights. Location is great, a very short walk to Circular Quay to catch transport and walking to shops & restaurants at The Rocks. The suite was equipped with everything we needed, kitchen, laundry, 2 bathrooms, lounge area & dining area. Rooms were clean and beds reasonable comfortable. We had no problems with all 5 of us fitting into the suite comfortably. The hotel has a great pool on 24th floor, again with great views towards the harbour & city. The pool is heated and has a great big window at the side where you can see underwater !!! It also has a small gym, spa and sauna. The only downside we had staying at the hotel was a small incident of missing jewellery (which we reported) otherwise our stay was wonderful & I would recommend the hotel to anyone considering staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location on the Rocks”
Reviews.Author: Dacuk
Reviews.Content: Quay West suites are superbly located for Circular Quay. The rooms were well maintained and quite spacious. We had a city view room, which was fine. There is a viewing room on 23rd floor from which you can see Sydney Harbour bridge and the Opera House. The suites are well situated for excellent restaurants along Circular Quay. Martin Place and the rest of downtown are within easy walking distance along George St. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “5 star accommodation - a let down”
Reviews.Author: NzBlackie
Reviews.Content: Was looking forward to staying at this 5star hotel. Had booked a 2 bedroom suite for 4 adults and a 1 bedroom suite for my elderly parents. The view from our suite was spectacular, however the general cleanliness of both suites were very dissappointing. eg. Grubby dining chairs, glassware needed cleaning before using. Pool was filthy. Smelly bathroom, large brown stains in grout around toilet, shower didn't drain properly, hence overflowed onto floor. Took ages to drain away. Worn and stained carpet. Have stayed in 5 star accommoation before and this was no where near it. Would not recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great break away”
Reviews.Author: holiday44Qld
Reviews.Content: Quay West is just beautiful. My husband and i along with our 2 boys spent Easter there. It is a great location and the Teppanyaki just up the street is one of the best i have eaten. The pool is magnificent the kids loved it. The room was clean with ample space. Room service was great. Valet parking was great. Overall we had a fantastic experience and i would highly recommend Quay West Suites.

Reviews.Title: “What a view!”
Reviews.Author: KalenaJeanne
Reviews.Content: I just recently returned from a 2 week vacation to Australia. We booked thru Azumano Travel, Portland, OR (they are great!!). I usually do all the planning myself but there were 9 of us and I needed help. We chose the Quay West Suites for its location and availability for 4 rooms. We were not planning on renting a car and wanted to be near the transportation hub. Only a short walk to a ferry, the busses or the trains. We spent 5 nights here. The views from all of our rooms were wonderful. I can't say enough. I had a room for 3 people (and we had 3 one bedroom rooms) and had the exact view I found when browsing the online information. We looked out over Sydney Harbor, Harbor Bridge and the Opera House. We had a full kitchen, laundry in room and lots of space (we had a 2 bedroom suite) with two bathrooms. The rooms were clean and well stocked. The carpet was a little worn but no smoke smells or other irritants. The staff was always available to answer questions and help in any way. No waits! There is a restaurant downstairs (Harrington) that we tried twice for breakfast. It was less than impressive. The first breakfast we had there was "just okay". The 2nd day my omelette was not completely done in the middle. There were a few issues from others in the party. We found everything in Sydney to be very expensive. There was a restaurant across the street called "Jacksons". Great food and better prices. Their staff was friendly and fun!! We ate there several times but also found many other worthy places to eat. I would definitely consider staying here again. As an aside..we were limited as to when we could go. There are less people at this time of the year but there can be lots of rain. Warm but wet!

Reviews.Title: “This is definitely the place to be.”
Reviews.Author: Sterling_8
Reviews.Content: We have just read the previous extensive review and every word is correct. We were amazed by the view from our 20th floor suite - it seemed like a four day entertainment that had been put on for us with the bridge, opera house, the harbour and the Rocks area in full and splendid view. The suite was just like a home with everything that we needed and the space...................amazing! Melanie, Graham and Melissa could not have been more helpful from the moment we arrived to when we left. Also, it is so convenient with George St, Circular Quay and the main shops just a few minutes away. Breakfast was excellent and although we had planned to try other places, after the first day, we only wanted to breakfast there. We were truly sorry to leave after our 4 days and look forward to going back as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Go for the view alone”
Reviews.Author: Andy M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Quay west on our arrival in Oz for three days in the middle of December. As first timers to the land down under we could not have picked a better spot. As obviously mentioned in previous reviews the view from these apartments are tremendous, well they are not wrong, whatever time of day or night you are drawn to the living room which overlooks the stunning view of the Harbour Bridge and Sydney opera House, all I can say is this is a living painting and should be entitled 'Life on the Harbour' Enough about the view I am sure you are already sold. The suites, well one of the best we stayed in, very comfortable, spacious, ameneties such as washing machine, dryer were very good. There is a small kitchen area with a large fridge,dishwasher ,microwave, toaster everything really. The only reason I do not rate this as excellent was that Reception did not inform us that there was a free Breakfast on arrival. We did not eat in the Suites but this brings me on to the great location, there is no need to eat there as in two minutes walking distance there are a number of eateries serving Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner. (George Street). It would appear that cafes are linked to the work place and wherever there is a office you will find Food. Only five minutes away is a Lindt Chocolate cafe worth a visit ,they only exist in Sydney. You are also close to the Rocks area of Sydney which has an abundance of History , cafes and small shops and a large Sydney Information centre. All in all I recommend the Suites for Families, there is a pool and Gym which we used and enclose photos of, and of course did I mention the view.......

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but worth it”
Reviews.Author: vicsterLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a family with 2 young kids in a 2 bed harbour view suite. My God well worth the extra for THAT view - a completely uninterrupted and direct view of Opera House, Harbour Bridge and Circular Quay - we could have sat all day and night and just looked out the window. We requested a higher room to get a better view and got the 22nd floor. Really great location for the quay (literally 5 mins walk to ferries, watch out for the steep walk back uphill), the Rocks and the CBD, so overall I'd say worth the price. They were chocca full but the service was still good. Our suite was thoughtfully laid out, spacious, clean, well decorated and maintained with all the facilities you'd expect. Kitchen and bathrooms nicely luxurious, living area furniture was a bit functional and practical, I guess geared at long stay families who no doubt give it a bit of a hammering, but still tasteful. Good room service menu, we only ate once in the restaurant for breakfast as it was a bit businessy, but so many great restaurants around no problem. We loved this place, very sad to leave (had to relocate to slightly cheaper apartment!) and would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A+ for Families at Quay West”
Reviews.Author: IslandGrl
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property four times now with my family and the Quay West has yet to dissappoint. We first stayed at the Quay West seven years ago on the recommendation of a travel agent. After arriving in the middle of a record setting hailstorm, the entire city of Sydney was without power. The with charm and grace, the bellhops lugged our giant suitcases up 10 flights of stairs with only the glow of flashlights to guide us. Huffing and puffing, it was an experience I will never forget. We returned to Sydney in August 2007, again to stay at the Quay West. I must say I was just as pleased years later. We love the magnificent view and the spaciousness of the apartments. The location is perfect for sightseeing. Everyone in our family of five had their own comfortable bed - plus two bathrooms AND a washer/dryer. The kitchen is adequate. Perfectly suited for a take-out dinners and everything you need to make your own breakfasts. There are grocery stores within walking distance. One of our rooms had an enormous patio. But perhaps our favorite amenity of this hotel is it's swimming pool, hot tub, workout room and sauna on the upper floors. There is nothing better to combat jet-lag or relax from a day of sightseeing than a refreshing swim or a work-out. Most of the time, we were the lone occupants in the facility. The view over the city and harbor is breathtaking. I highly recommend Quay West for families looking for higher quality, spacious accommodations in a picture perfect location in the heart of Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “great location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: chargiffy
Reviews.Content: Had a great time will sTay again ,Buffet breakfast was great .they have upgrade the area and looks great.We loved the food and staff .We stayed over 12 nights and enjoyed every night .

Reviews.Title: “Great Views and Location”
Reviews.Author: GoneTravelin07
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 2 bedroom/2 bath room overlooking the Harbour. The view from the room was amazing - you could take in the Harbour Bridge, Circular Quay, Rocks area and Opera House. Saw fireworks over Harbour one night from room. Room was really clean, with nice furniture, a good sized kitchen and a small laundry room with washer/dryer. Very quiet on upper floors. Great location for getting around and seeing the sights. Restaurants in the area are kind of pricey - better to go out towards Chinatown or other neighborhoods where the locals live.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but will not stay again”
Reviews.Author: MattandTaz
Reviews.Content: My newlywed wife and I stayed here on our first night as a married couple. Actually we stayed here for 3 nights (we booked a special package - stay 3 pay for 2). We arrived after our wedding reception at approximately 12.45am and we were checked in straight away. Our bags were brought up to our room by the bellboy - fantastic. When we booked the room we made a note to the reservations office that it was our honeymoon and we had requested either a harbour view or a floor high up. We ended up with the latter (approx 15 floors up from memory). The view was ok and if we looked to the very side of our living area we were able to see a glimpse of the harbour bridge. Lucky for us if we looked into the reflection of the windows of the hotel opposite we could in fact see the harbour. When we had settled into the room (approx 20 mins later) I phoned reception and requested a bottle of champagne or wine be sent up (because I was assuming this would be included already and 'waiting in our room'). We were expecting a "no problem sir it will be up shortly" but instead we were cut off and were told that we would be receiving a call back from the night manager. About 10 minutes later the manager phoned back and said "sorry we are unable to offer you any champagne as you did not request it when you booked". WHAT? AM I HEARING THIS RIGHT??? We could not believe what he had just told us!! To be denied this on your own wedding night really got us down. I mean we have had friends and family stay in cheaper accommodation on their own wedding night and they even got a surprise in their room (strawberries AND champagne). But for us we got NOTHING. Only a room on a supposed "high floor". We really felt like we were staying in a motel at this point on. Because thats how we felt we were being treated. Don't get me wrong, the room was lovely and spacious, bathroom fittings were ok etc. The location was great as well (5 min walk to Circular Quay, the Rocks etc). We would not stay again though and I would definitely NOT recommend it for honeymooners unless you ensure you email the property 1 week before checking in to make sure you get your complimentary bottle of champagne, even though they will probably try and charge you for it!!!!! How ridiculous...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Views from the Quay West”
Reviews.Author: Jennt
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here in October 2007, for a "girls" night away. There were 6 of us, and we were originally booked into a 2bdrm and a 1bdrm, but asked about the 3bdrm when we arrived. Although the 3bdrm is usually only available for a minimum of 2nts, they had one available, and the wonderful concierge was happy to book us in. He even gave us a tour of the 3bdrm vs the 2bdrm before we made up our minds... Well, the 3bdrm definitely won us over, as did the promise of access to the private swimming pool/sauna/spa. We had a great evening and no-one complained about the bedding. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone wanting good value with the MOST AMAZING views of Sydney harbour. We could see way out over the Heads and out to sea - 2 lots of fireworks went off on the harbour that night - what a treat!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, amazing facilities... beautiful views”
Reviews.Author: kerry_manchester
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel, especially the views of the harbour as they are breath taking!! Gym was a nice size, the pool was awesome.. The edge of the pool layout onto the window so we watched the sun set as we swam in the pool.. Very cool. Sauna was very nice too. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suit and I was amazed by the size. It had a sofa, table which sat 6 people, a dishwasher, washing machine, tumble dryer and robes and slippers were provided. Having dinner with the views of the harbour in the background was a priceless experience - this hotel was the highlight of our stay in AUSTRALIA.

Reviews.Title: “Views to die for, but service somewhat lacking”
Reviews.Author: Katgalmusic
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed four nights in a one-bedroom, 22nd floor apartment suite at the Quay West, and enjoyed it, with some service complaints. The location can't be beat, overlooking Sydney's Rocks district , the Harbour and the Opera House. The rooms are nice, if a bit plain, but a washer-dryer is a great plus if you've been traveling a while. The only drawback was some pretty incompetent housekeeping service we had to complain about. However, the management was very accomodating and apologetic, sending up a complimentary bottle of wine and a cheese & fruit plate. This is a great place for location, views and the added convenience of kitchen, laundry room, etc. It also has a large, gorgeous heated swimming pool on the 23rd floor with views of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal View”
Reviews.Author: bevyboy
Reviews.Content: It's worth staying here just for the view. Imagine the perfect postcard view of Sydney's landmarks and we got it in our harbour view 2 bedroom suite. To wake up to that view for the 3 nights we stayed there was brilliant. The rooms are excellent, plenty of space for 5 of us, the pool's were good, the only downside was the breakfast price but as someone else pointed out there are plenty of cafe's nearby so really a non issue. It's close to everything you want to see like the bridge and opera house plus close to the boats that take you round the harbour or too the beaches. All in all a great location and would recommend this with no fear of criticism.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Northampton_Girl
Reviews.Content: My husband & I were really impressed with the standard of these apartments. We had views of the city from our balcony, which were fantastic - every bit as good as those of the harbour. The rooms were decorated to high standard (mini bar prices were even higher than normal though!). Location was excellent, right in the heart of everything and only a short walk to the Opera House, Bridge & commercial district. The last part of the walk to the apartments is fairly step, but nothing that someone of even average fitness should struggle with. Pool was fantastic, on the 19th floor so it has amazing views over Sydney. It also contains a spa bath, sun deck and sauna, and the pool was heated to a great temperature. We tended to go out in the morning, back for a swim and then out again later. We were there for 4 days and never saw a single other person in the pool! All in all a great choice, we would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for view, space and location”
Reviews.Author: oowan
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights here with two 2-room suties for our extended family. We agree with most of the previous comments, except we believe this is excellent value for the views and location, and would stay there again. Agree it is not a 5-star hotel as far as quality of the rooms, but you are paying for the large room space, views and location. We have stayed at 5-star hotel suites in the same area and paid almost twice as much.....so, for a large family this is not a bad deal. Completely agree that the $31 breakfast price is a ripoff, although they offered us a deal that we could buy in advance for all the morning breakfasts for $20 if we took that price when we checked it. We declined....there are many little breafast shops in Sydney within walking distance. .

Reviews.Title: “Best views in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: 1travel5MV
Reviews.Content: The Quay West Suites Sydney was the best hotel for our family vacation and stay of five nights. Being a family of five, normal hotels are always impossible to stay in due to us always needing two rooms. We didn't want to have to sacrifice class for space and the Quay West didn't disappoint. The single best factor about our two bedroom suite was the view of the harbor. It is stunning to wake up every day with a front row view of the bridge on your left, the activity of Circular Quay in the center, and the Opera House to the right. The view is worth every penny and I couldn't take enough pictures of it. The furniture is nice and is done in a modern style. I found the style a nice compliment to the view which is the true show case. A stuffy room with lots of wood and fabric would take away from the views which is the true natural artwork of the room. The kitchen came fully equipped and we were able to make breakfast each day in the room and had two dinners in the room also. The hotel will go shopping for you (for a price of course:) or you can walk ten minutes to the Coles Central Grocery on George Street. The beds were a little firm, but none the less still comfortable. The two bedrooms each had a view out over the water that leads into Darling Harbor. We used the washing machine twice and it was nice to refresh clothes before continuing our three week vacation. The two bathrooms were nicely appointed in marble and fit in nicely. The staff is kind and very professional. The maids did an excellent job and the room looked spotless every time we returned. The location is one of the best in the desirable Rocks/ Circular Quay area. It was a five minute walk to the ferries, ten to the Opera and Royal Gardens, five to ten minutes to the city center, and fifteen minutes to Darling Harbor. Sydney is not a huge city to walk around (in the CBD), but some areas are obviously more upscale than others and the Quay West is in one the nicest as exemplified by all its upscale neighbors like the Four Seasons, Shangri La, ect... and the designer stores around it. I used the gym and the treadmill is fine and the pool is very nice, but we didn't use it as it isn't large enough for the amount of people that wanted to swim. There were probably six groups/ families in the pool everytime we wanted to go and elbow to elbow in a pool isn't our idea of fun. On a quiet day I think the pool is probably great. Other than that, the hotel was great, the staff worked out our confusing reservation/ change of dates seamlessly, and we had a great time in Sydney while at the Quay West. I highly recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chern
Reviews.Content: We walked in to this hotel on the way to see our suite that we had booked at the next door Shangri-la. The staff were welcoming and friendly ( Mr Ivada and Ms Catarina especially). We subsequently chose this property over the Shangri-la because of the wonderful views, the more useful and useable space, the balconies and a nice clean decor. We'd stay here again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Views From a 3* Hotel”
Reviews.Author: simongee
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this apart-hotel for 4 nights at the beginning of April. We had booked a 2 bed, 2 bath suite facing the Opera House and the Bridge. We got exactly what we booked! We arranged with the concierge to organise a taxi for us. Although it was confirmed, the driver arrived 15 minutes after we came through customs and only after I telephoned to chase. A great start! We did arrive earlier than the stated check in time and we did have to wait for the room. The suite itself had an amazing view and the size of the suite was excellent too with a fully fitted kitchen, dining room, 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms. The only downside which cheapened the suite was the furniture which probably came from Ikea. The beds were not the most comfortable either but the view was unbelievable only eqally by The Four Seasons and The Shangrai La located either side. Our room rate included breakfast which was an adequate buffet. Basically, what you would expect from a 3/4* hotel. The gym was quite small and clearly hadn't been cleaned for quite a while (a real let down), the indoor pool is simply a large plunge pool. Position of the apart-hotel in The Rocks area is ideal for getting around and there are many great restaurants close to the Hyatt (5 mins away). Would we stay there again? Probably not. I think we would prefer the luxury of one of the real 5* hotels next time.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this apartment”
Reviews.Author: Granniesabroad
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Quay West apartments during the Sydney Bridge celebrations in March. The apartment was well appointed and very clean and being situated at The Rocks very convenient for sightseeing. We found the reception staff very helpful and likewise the lady who cleaned our room each day. We enjoyed a concert at the Opera House and a trip under the Bridge in a flotilla during the 75th Bridge celebrations, altogether a visit to be remembered. We had a great time in Sydney which was made all the more enjoyable by our accommodation. [-]

Reviews.Title: “You pay for the views!!!”
Reviews.Author: tictoc134
Reviews.Content: Great views- Yes!!! 5 star - not so sure...Found staff not very friendly at all and seemed annoyed if you wanted them to do anything or asked them anything. Bathroom was fantastic and the room itself was good but I'm not sure if value for money was obtained. A bit overpriced for me...I've stayed in better!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MaryMagee
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Austrailia very jet-lagged but when we were shown our room we all just stared out of the window. We were totally blown away by the spectacular view which encapsulated the Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. Our next few jet-lagged sleepless nights were a joy with such a fantastic view! Day or night the view is amazing! The room was very spaious with two bedrooms and bathrooms and a very well equipped laundry room and kitchen. We were two minutes walk from Circular Quay so we were able to get ferries easily to Darling Harbour and the surrounding Sydney. There are also plenty of restaurants (although slightly expensive) within walking distance and the hotel has an ample buffet breakfast every morning. We thoroughly enjoyed our time there and would most definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Buisness trip okay”
Reviews.Author: OzVoyager
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Quay West during a business trip to Sydney. The suites are adequate, the location fantastic. I was in a single suite, which had a large living area. The kitchen had a very good set of kitchen utensils, crockery etc compared to what I have found in other suite hotels. Air conditioning could be directed either to the living area or bedroom. Cooling was okay but it is a cumbersome system, especially in summer. Staff are friendly but not that attentive to detail, such as having to carry my bags out to the taxi and requesting a hairdryer twice.

Reviews.Title: “Great views, lacked service and poor security”
Reviews.Author: ukm2009freqtrav
Reviews.Content: If you can get a harbour view 2 bedroom then you will have some amazing views from these suites. Bathrooms and bedrooms are not 5 star standard but they are a good size. Housekeeping in this hotel is terrible - our room attendant argued with us when we asked why our room hadn't been cleaned as requested and then got angry when we asked him to wait when he came back and he told us that we were keeping him from going home!! Rude and unacceptable. Hotel management were apologetic and did go out of their way to fix problems. Hotel security is a problem - 4 pairs of jeans went missing (assumed stolen) from the room / property store.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: jamehammah
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed by Quay West. It is in a great location with wonderful views, true. But it is definitely not a 5-star hotel. I was excited to stay there after reading reviews here and it didn't live up to its billing. It was clean and tidy on the surface but there was no attention to detail, the furniture was tired, the front desk staff nice but not terribly helpful. The kitchen was really randomly appointed so cooking was actually quite difficult (and as I was staying there with a toddler I needed to be able to cook). That said, room service was good. It wasn't bad, but wasn't great either.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: SBCATraveler
Reviews.Content: This was our second time visiting Sydney and the Harbour Rocks area. But the first time at the Quay West Hotel. The hotel is in convenient location within walking distance to the harbour bridge, ferry boats, opera house, gardens, shopping, restaurants (you do not need a car). The rooms are suites with kitchen, living room and a laundry area. All the comforts of home. The view from our room was over looking the harbour. It was easy to stand by the window for long periods at a time. The staff at the hotel was very helpful. We look forward returning to Sydney and this hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Quay West Suites Sydney
HotelInfo.Address: 98 Gloucester St | The Rocks, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
